description:
Great selection of whiskeys, which for me, means a lot. Decent food options, even if you are a vegetarian. Had the adult grilled cheese, great combo of cheeses, jam, and apples. I love coming here to grab a kolsch and a bourbon. And the service is amazing! Always speedy and polite. 

I work in the area, and ever since I found this little gem, it's my go to spot.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Good location in North Beach, but not enough bartenders when there are a lot of people inside. They ran out of Tito's vodka by 10:30pm.   There is a very narrow walkway in between the bar stools and the tables and it was very warm inside. 

Small but quaint place if you want a local place to hang out.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I have been to Aventine dozens of times over the years, both for work events and also just personal outings. I should mention, that this review will not be covering any of the food offerings, as I have never ordered anything other than drinks here. Honestly I didn't even know that they had food until I read the other reviews. Whoops!

Anyway, this is such a good spot to grab a few drinks after work. An absolute favorite of mine. While it can be difficult to get seating unless you arrive early, standing is usually not much of an issue. The happy hour here is great, with a decent selection of beers included, and cocktails right around $10 or so, which is not bad given the location. I also find the selection of beers to be more than satisfactory, and usually inclusive of some Bay Area favorites, such as Drakes and Fieldwork.

Sorry I can't speak to the quality of the food. But if you are coming here for the drinks you will not be disappointed. They have absinth, which is an absolute treat to both be served and then eventually drink, in addition to all of the wonderful offerings above. So if you weren't sold before, hopefully you are now!
author: Kevin B.

description: This restaurant is located in a nicer part of the city, there are upscale markets close by. The restaurant itself was relatively empty and a little bit dark. I ordered the margarita pizza, I love pizza and I didn't love their pizza. I didn't even remotely liked it. The pizza was overcooked on the the top and undercooked on the bottom. I have flour all over my black pants because I made the mistake of ordering to go. The dough was also not completely cooked through, if you enjoy the taste of raw flour and dough then this is your pizza. There was no flavor to their pizza even if it was properly cooked, and it was oily. You'll be better off warming up boxed pizza. Completely unacceptable to serve subpar pizza at an ITALIAN restaurant, maybe it's Italian only by name. I don't recommend this place until they learn how to make a decent pizza.
author: Maria N.

description:
I stumbled upon this place walking the streets of San Fran. Looking through the window it looked like a cozy place to dine with reasonably priced food.

Looking at some of the other reviews and photos, I decided to stay away from the pizza and go for a sandwich. 

The grilled cheese is delicious paired with a jam and apples. My only knock on this was the menu said Granny Smith apples and mine came with red delicious. It still tasted great but if you're picky with your apples maybe double check before ordering. I paired mine with the side salad. As someone who prefers my salad with just lettuce and dressing, this was perfect. The dressing was lite yet flavorful and a little citrusy.

The popcorn was outstanding. It's enough to feed more than a couple people. There was enough cheese on it that even as you ate past the first layer, the popcorn underneath still had some on it. You could tell it was made fresh too as the waiter said it'd take about 15 minutes to prepare.

There was one waiter at lunch when I was there. He did an awesome job of keeping track of all his tables and making sure drinks were being refilled.
author: Maria P.

description: This is my go to for drinks after work with coworkers. It has a nice vibe with a great selection of cocktails, beer and wine and a decent happy hour deal. My favorite thing is the little bar food spread on weekdays that resembles the Italian aperitivo the bar is trying to resemble. It can get busy on a Thursday but I like it for a Tuesday or Wednesday.
author: Sharvari J.

description:
Stopped by for drinks and light snacks with the coworkers after work!

I got a virgin cucumber mojito-- it was almost too sweet, but anything with cucumber is very refreshing.  The ice to drink ratio was a bit too high-- I was done with the drink in about 3 minutes.

The bell pepper (raw) stuffed goat cheese was a good idea, but there was some more flavoring that needed to be added to the dish. Olives were standard.
author: Nicole H.

description: Aventine has a great happy hour with a bunch of reasonably priced cocktails and snacks. The meatballs were fantastic. I would recommend checking out the happy hour for sure.
author: Rohan K.

description: Loved this spot for a Friday happy hour with some teammates. Very reasonable prices at happy hour, $8 glasses of wine which you won't usually find anywhere near the fi-di. Didn't explore any food options but I'm sure those are tasty as well. Service was fast, wine was cold, and the outside patio atmosphere was great. Will definitely be back soon, thank you Aventine!
author: Kara N.

description: Stumbled into Aventine for a bite to eat and drinks!!! Great service and Food ask for Zuzanna  is an amazing waitress/bartender! All the way from Texas and found the right spot!!
author: Lisa L.

description:
This is a sweet spot to go for drinks after work or just for fun with a group of friends. There's bar seating, high tables for groups of 4 + those who don't mind standing, and a comfy couch area by the window for larger groups. Good variety of beers on tap but you should go for the cocktails here. I'm not big on sweet cocktails/drinks that sound like they contain lots of sugar, but I decided to try new things this time around just for the heck of it. 

I got the Açai lemonade and the spritzer from the cocktail menu. They were both surprisingly well balanced and tasty! I would order them again. Also got the Moscow Mule, standard but good. The BEST part of the night though was the Popcorn with parsley and truffle oil. IT WAS AMAZING. Especially if you appreciate fine tasting popcorn. I expected the bowl to be a small handful but it was huge and perfect for sharing with a group of 4+ people. Will I return? Yes. Should you try this place out? Hell yes. Do it for the popcorn.
author: Saachi G.

description:
I was able to experience my first drink as a 21 year old here. I arrived with my coworkers for Happy Hour on a Monday afternoon. We were given the opportunity to choose between outdoor seating or inside, and we obviously chose the first. 

-As a party of 4, we made a perfect fit outside at our table. If it's an Indian Summer in San Francisco or the temperature is above the 60's degree, choose outdoor seating because it is soso nice and relaxing. Although there can be disruptions like cars honking or the nearby fire truck speeding by, the view of The Transamerica Pyramid seals the deal. 

-As an inexperienced drinker, I was unsure exactly what to order. The server was nice enough to wish me a Happy Belated Birthday, while also offering possible suggestions for me. I decided to order the Dutch Courage-Genever, Lemon Juice, Rosemary, Raspberry, Ginger Beer. I didn't want anything too strong, but I also didn't want to be the one sipping on Capri Sun. Although it first tasted tart, I am proud to say that the Dutch Courage is now one of my favorite drinks.

I would come again after work for Happy Hour. The staff was friendly, and everyone made sure that we were accommodated.
author: Erica K.

description: Terrible service. We ordered two pizzas, waited about half an hour, and only when I checked in that they told us the order was lost and the kitchen was closed. This was after they dropped plates and forks for us to use for our orders. There was no apology, no way to make it up to us. Never bringing my friends here again. Because to me, I'm the one that ends up looking bad.
author: Paul O.

description:
It was my first time coming here to this place. I had just purchased my first lunch off of MealPal and this place was the closest to my work. Was definitely surprised when I walked into this place as I was expecting a restaurant. It was most certainly not a restaurant and very much a bar. As I approached the bartender, she gave me a weird look as if she were thinking that I'm not old enough to be in a bar. I came in and told the bartender I was picking up my lunch off mealpal. She asked for my name and handed me my order. 

I had the pizza topped with prosciutto and arugula. The crust was very thin. I was expecting it to be more of a thick crust from the picture they used for advertising. The bottom of the box was also quite greasy. Overall, it tasted alright. They weren't too generous with the amount of prosciutto but it wasn't a stingy amount either. the dough itself wasn't too bad. Since it was thin, it had a nice crunch on the outside and was still soft on the inside. I just wished that it wasn't so greasy as that was sort of a turn off to see. Perhaps coming into a bar for food was not the best idea. Will be back during their happy hour as they do have some pretty good deals.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
When: Friday, March 17th at 6pm
Why: St Patrick's Day

A girlfriend and I decided to meet up some of our friends at Aventine. I was a little hesitant as I remember the ridiculous line from last year. (We decided to skip it that year and go elsewhere.) It turns out, only the front entrance has a line around the block. The back entrance wasn't bad at all. We only waited about 5 minutes, if even that.

The music was bumping and it was super crowded. Our friends were by the front entrance, so we had to squeeze our way through the crowd. This took a while as it was super crowded. We finally found them by the bar and got the drinking started.

*Cocktails ($12): Jameson, Absolut, Beefeater, Patron, Fernet
*Beer ($8): Stella, Guinness
*Red Bull ($4): Original, Sugar free, Tropical, Cranberry, Blueberry

Make sure to bring cash as the bar outside is cash only. I ended up drinking two Stellas over the course of the hour and a half we were here. Now, I'm old, so I found the whole block party thing a little too loud and crowded. I'm glad my friends were standing in a space off to the side as people were constantly knocking into other people while walking around. I saw a couple of spilled beers and you know how I hate wasting alcohol! The DJ was good and I really enjoyed the music he was playing. Towards the end of our time here, it got a little less crowded as I think people were heading to other events.

Fun experience as I've never been to Aventine for St Patrick's Day.
author: Elena N.

description:
Their prosciutto and arugula pizza is a revelation, and their mealpal service is also excellent and fast. About as good as it gets if you're looking for fast, high quality pizza in downtown SF. 

I ate it too fast to take a picture but I promise you it was amazing.
author: Holden L.

description:
Such a pretty place with such a bad service!
The venue itself is so inviting and seems like a great match to the whole street it is on. Sadly that is all there it to it, based on my first visit there.
Ordered Aperol Spritz, which had all the color and looks of the Aperol but zero taste. Then we asked for bruschetta, which we never received. Bartenders kept on coming to some other tables but not to ours. We asked for the bill as well as to check what happened with the missing bruschetta, the bartender behaved like he does not care. Overall, it felt like service is so disorganized/disattached to this place, that as much as I want to like it (close to work, nice venue, super nice bar manager when I picked up my MealPal lunch during the day), it really is hard to rate this place well now
author: Michal K.

description: I placed an order for Margherita Pizza from here using Mealpal. Their description said it contains tomato, basil and extra virgin olive oil. When I go to pick up, what they offer instead is a sad looking plain cheese pizza that had the texture and taste of $1 microwave pizza you can get in frozen section at Safeway. The picture speaks for itself...
author: Karan D.

description:
Decent happy hour - a little pricier than others, but probably just because of the location (super close to the Fidi) 

The veev drink was so so good I had to have 2! It's a little on the sweet side but you don't feel terrible because there's acai. That's healthy, right ? There's no true happy hour food menu but the items on the bar menu are decently priced. The bruschetta with goat cheese and beets is delicious ! We also got the margerita pizza - simple but delicious with red pepper flakes added. Also, the truffle popcorn ... yum! Huge bowl 

We'll be back!
author: danielle a.

description: All around good spot for happy hour and drinks/food, but would definitely not recommend hosting a private event here.  After several days of back and forth emails planning, when we showed up no one at the venue even knew we had reserved a space downstairs.  Instead of being able to order drinks at the bar, they pulled two servers to manage a group of 30+.  When people obviously started ordering at the bar to get served, they refused to count this towards our minimum and threatened to charge my credit card for the difference.  Overall bad experience, would prefer to have gone somewhere a bit more organized and accommodating for a group larger than 10.
author: Eric L.

description: If you are looking for a private event space check out Aventine! We held our wedding reception here and it couldn't have gone better. Nick was great to work with and their bar staff is amazing!  All our guests were raving about how great the venue was and how much they enjoyed the cocktails. Even with such a long list of specialty cocktails the bartenders were fast, friendly and efficient! Thank you to Aventine and your amazing staff for an absolutely perfect wedding reception!
author: Denae D.

description:
Great spot for drinks! Came here last night with my fiance and his coworkers. We sat in a private area with comfortable seating and one big table. Loved that we had our own bartender and didn't have to go to the bar. The moscow mules were great. 

Wasn't a fan of the DJ's music so hence the 4 star review. Hopefully next time we come here, the DJ will play better music (or at least not the same techno/house stuff the entire time...).
author: Anastasia N.

description:
I've been here when it's packed and when it's nearly empty, and I prefer the nearly empty better.  That way you can get one of the small cozy tables on the side, get the waiter's attention, and enjoy some of their many drink options.

I've never eaten here, so don't know about the food, but their drinks are interesting and pretty strong (although priced at SF market - which translates to expensive).  The happy hour is fairly limited, but will at least allow you to stop by without breaking the bank.
author: Denis S.

description: Never knew this spot existed in my 4 years in SF until now. Always went to Kels in the past.... if I only knew (smh). This pace is great, so cute! Love the decors with the old books on the walls and the cozy nook int he window. Apparently they have block parties? Sign me up! Have only had their drinks here, scratch that... have only had their Venetian Spritz here and it is so freaking good. Fresh and delicious and it's on happy hour (which goes until 11pm on Fridays btw). Had two and had a nice little buzz to start my weekend. Even inspired me to go home and try to make my own Spritz. Definitely will come back for an after work happy hour!
author: Alex S.

description: Cool environment but not worth it! Subpar service. Was at the place for about 2 hours... Waitstaff came once to take our order and were too busy chatting at the bar to check back in! Our order of bruschetta never arrived, again waitstaff must have been way too busy chatting!
author: Marcos R.

description:
Met up my friend who works in FiDi for Happy Hour here. I arrived just in time to snatch the last 2 seats at the bar. While waiting for my friend, I looked at the Happy Hour menu and decided on a $9 Moscow Mule. It was ice cold and served in a copper mug so bonus points for that. Unfortunately, the second Moscow Mule was in a funky copper mug that looked like it should be retired from serving drinks.

My friend pointed out the interesting observation that the regular menu lists many drinks for $11, with a note that they are $9 during Happy Hour but the Happy Hour menu omits most of those drink options. Hmm...odd?
author: Yi Z.

description:
## Aventine No More, Pricing Shenanigans ##

Let me preface by saying I've been coming here for years, off and on. I always thought it was a cool place. We've been coming here a lot more in recent months since I started working nearby. 

Then, some strange things started happening.

Several months ago, I went to Happy Hour there to order a Happy Hour drink. There was an $8 Old Grand Dad which I ordered on the rocks. The bill came out and the drink was $10 and I asked why. She said it was because I ordered it on the rocks and they pour you a little more than without. Weird since I've seen other places charge you more for neat since they claim to pour you more there. Whatever, it's $2.

Fast forward to last week. I ordered the same thing but this time neat. Again, I was charged $10 and she said it was because I ordered it neat. I was thoroughly confused now and reminded her that I was charged $10 for the opposite the last time. This time, she said that On the Rocks OR Neat are both extra $2! And what I should have ordered to get the Happy Hour price is a SHOT. 

Really? I have to say a shot? Me pointing to the Old Grand Dad on the happy hour menu wasn't sufficient? Or asking for the happy hour Old Grand Dad? If you're going to charge me for more, how about a heads up.

To add insult to injury, someone in our party had ordered 3 Whistle Pigs and was charged $30 each! Laphroaig 10 Year was $16! Whistle Pig is $18 at Local Edition and Barbarossa has Laphroaig for $12-13 I believe. Come on now, seriously? This isn't some 5 star hotel. 

Needless to say, there was significant sticker shock and I do not plan to return to Aventine ever again. Will definitely spread the word to all my coworkers and friends.

Good bye Aventine.
author: Benjamin N.

description: This is a nice bar with pretty good service.  Drinks were fine - SF priced (i.e. not at all cheap, but I would say standard for a nice place).  I only had the cheese plate which was surprisingly good.  I would definitely come back, but probably wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: David G.

description:
Nice decent place for early happy hour.  My group was here at 4pm on a weekday so it was literally dead.  We did get to sit at the tables outside which was nice since the weather lately has been great.  The Happy Hour drinks were actually pretty decent.  They mixed a good drink and the beer/wine specials were solid.  We didn't get any food but from the looks of this place, it's not that big so I can't imagine how busy this place will be during the traditional Happy Hour times.

They did make a good margarita and the Acai Lemonade was decent.  If I'm ever back here, then I may likely come back.
author: Ben H L.

description: Dropped in for lunch during a weekday - the pizza was pretty good, but it was really pretty loud so not the best for a work lunch.  Much more of a bar environment.  Good for an after work drink though - seems to have a great drink menu.
author: Vivian W.

description:
One word: Fun 
Two words- Truffle Popcorn 
Three words- Bomb ass parties (cinco de mayo; st Patrick's day)
author: Julianna I.

description:
Came here for happy hour with a coworker and again for Cinco de Mayo celebration.

Happy hour: good prices, for SF anyway. Spritzers are my favorite and brought me back to studying abroad in Italy (swoon). It is a pretty small venue and gets packed so finding seating can be difficult. Had no difficulty getting drinks and the line for the bathroom moved quickly. Definitely look forward to going back!

Cinco de Mayo: went to their alley party (that apparently they throw for many holidays) and it was a blast! The line to get in was intimidating but it moved quickly. CASH ONLY FOR THESE PARTIES!! Learned the hard way and had to exit (after shoving my way in) so I could pull from the WF ATM down the street. They do have an ATM inside the alley but the line was way too long. Drinks were over priced, no surprises there. $14 for margaritas and $6.50 for Corona (lol) Pours were very generous for the margs though so no complaints there. There was a dance floor, food truck, and plenty of porta potties to keep everyone happy. Icing on the cake to have Donald Trump piñatas for people to destroy. Was a great way to celebrate after work!
author: Summer B.

description:
Good happy hour prices for beer close to the financial district. 

We ordered a cheese platter, which came with good portions of cheese. 

The cheese platter was regular price, no happy hour specials but it comes a decent amount
author: Marcia d.

description: I love this place! It's got a cool vibe during Happy Hour and even at lunch. The manager at night and during the day are both really friendly and attentive as is the rest of the staff. When I come for drinks, I always get a big bowl of Truffle Popcorn and I eat the entire bowl by myself because after a small handful, I can't stop. On this most recent lunch visit, two of us got the Yellow and Red Beet Salad made with frisse. I added steak and it was delish. My friend liked her Fontina Pizza a lot. It looked small since it was about 6 inches but she felt fulfilled after that and some beer. It tasted good and only cost $5 or $6 too!
author: Jen L.

description:
I really enjoyed this place. It is in a great location (right across from the TransAm Pyramid). The snacks are good. Had great drinks. 

I will definitely be back.
author: Rhian C.

description:
I only come here for happy hour and I always get the acai lemonade, Moscow  mule and the truffle popcorn! 

Servers here are ultra nice and cute!
author: Alice X.

description: Love Hotaling Pl. and their day events. Good burrata, Staff is sweet.
author: Antigone S.

description:
Standing in the shadow of the Transamerica pyramid, this Roman-inspired taverna has surprised me yet again with their appetizing lunch menu. I was here well over five years ago for a Yelp Elite event when it first opened and remembered the bar bites to be quite tasty. Actually I don't have to remember since I reviewed that event in my usual painstaking detail (review: http://bit.ly/1fuV9z7). I returned because I was having one of those days at work where I just had to leave the office for a bit to avoid a moment of career-threatening drama. As I meandered on the edge of the FiDi talking to myself like Cate Blanchett throughout "Blue Jasmine", I came upon Taverna Aventine and secured a high-top table to myself.

Among the several choices on the menu, I settled on the $14 Tuscan Steak Tramezzino, a buttery steak sandwich on a pretzel hoagie slathered with Gorgonzola aioli and truffle honey (photo: http://bit.ly/MRWaGS). With the addition of arugula, it made for a peppery-savory-sweet confection that was quite a treat for lunch. Instead of fries on the side, they provided a small mixed green salad and some vegetable chips which would have been my preference anyway (photo: http://bit.ly/1e8nYkY). The rest of the lunch menu sounds like solid selections for office drones like myself who are willing to spend a few more dollars to avoid a Lee's Deli run (literally) -  small pizzas, salumi, antipasti, even sliders. Perhaps I should meander over to these parts more often and not just as an escape route.

FOOD - 4 stars...one of the better steak sandwiches to be had in the FiDi
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...an unusually low-key bar setting during the lunch hour (photo: http://bit.ly/1js6oZV)
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...serviceable enough
TOTAL - 4 stars...Rome wasn't built in a day but I think that steak sandwich would have given hope to the empire
author: Ed U.

description: Taverna Aventine was great! It has a longer happy hour than most, it goes from 3-7 at least on Monday (that's when I went). It's right across from the TransAmerica building, yet it feels completely removed the financial district. inside is very cute and comfy, with an option to sit outside or in padded seats by the window. I tried the trip bruschetta with an Acai Lemonade. All three were amazing! The service was quick and friendly. I will definitely be going back!
author: Rachel E.

description:
Love this place! Used to come for happy hours when lived in the city, always a good spot.

Drinks and food = bomb. 

I also hosted my birthday here and the management (Rodrigo) was the best host ever. Made sure to accommodate request and gave a sweet deal as well. Definitely recommend if looking to host a bday or holiday party for work or whatever.
author: Mahsa T.

description:
Came here with couple friends for the first time.

Decent wine selection (and happy hour pricing), and while I did not pay too much attention to the food menu, the flatbreads/pizzas were gorgeous. The tuna tartare was one of the few memorable tartares I've had, thanks to this well-balanced and unusual mustard-y vinaigrette.

Took a star off because their HVAC system was blowing cold air directly onto us, and was only temporarily remedied at our request before starting back up again. Why would it need to be on at full blast on a cold summer San Francisco day?
author: VJ K.

description: Great happy hour spot.  However, their food is questionable.  I tried their tomato & Burrata sandwich via MealPal.  It came with side salad.  After I took a bite of the lettuce, I thought their dressing was really sandy.  When I took a close look, all the lettuce had dirty on it.  Ugh, so disgusting!
author: Klo H.

description:
After perusing through my lunch list, I realized I was a bit bored of the food options near my job so I came here at noon. Only one couple seated in empty bar. A few minutes later a kind lady, the bartender, came upstairs.

FOOD = First of all, the presentation was absolutely beautiful (like plating you see on TV). I ordered beef meatballs which came with crostini. Very flavorful! The food tasted like it was lovingly prepared, which surprised me. And because of the homeade vibe I will say paying a buck fifty for each small meatball is ok.
SERVICE = Bartender handled everything while I sat at the bar. Good convo.
AMBIANCE = I'm unsure of the style. There's stack of books to look like a library and lots of exposed wood. Couches near front windows. However the food was on the upscale side so I dunno what they're trying to convey.

Overall this is a party driven establishment. Happy hour is extremely popular. They tend to block the alley during drinking themed holidays so expect a line around the block.
author: McCracken C.

description: Went here only for drinks so no view on the food. Overall, this is a nice place to drink that balances being hipster enough by serving interesting cocktails with premium ingredients without the huge prices that might be associated. Cocktails are $9 during happy  hour and, I think, $11 the rest of the time. Service is good and the noise level is high. Not a huge find but, for a hip-enough bar in downtown SF with pretty good drinks, Taverna Aventine is a good choice.
author: Eli L.

description: Came here after work for a quick drink and some munchies.  Ordered the Margarita pizza and it was good.  The crust was perfect with just the right amount tomato sauce.  Also had the HH Acai Lemonade cocktail which was something I usually don't order but I found it quite tasty.  Wasn't too sweet or tart, but just perfect.  I will be back for launch as I'm always down this way.  Really excited to try their panini's.
author: Jon L.

description:
Came here at around 6:30pm on a weeknight for happy hour and it was extremely busy. Filled with lots of young professionals as you would expect. They have a downstairs as well which was slightly less crowded. We were only able to order drinks once before happy hour prices ended at 7pm. The bartender was too busy to be flagged down and I didn't see any servers so I couldn't order the truffle popcorn.

I ordered a glass of their $8 wine and one of their happy hour cocktails, acai lemonade. The acai lemonade was very sweet...perhaps too much because I could not taste any alcohol at all! 

The bar is dimly lit and pretty noisy so it's good for one on ones or going with a few friends. I probably wouldn't return because it was too crowded for a small space.
author: Vio C.

description: You can't serve mediocre cocktails and have rude service at the same time.
author: Bobby N.

description: their arugula/ prosciutto pizza is everything!! right along with their fizzy raspberry cocktail, not to mention their attention to detail and customer service :) you won't regret it!
author: Natalie F.

description:
Although it's really far out of my way most of the time, I like to come here for happy hour. The acai lemonade (lemonade, liqueur, and cranberry) is just strong enough to pack a bunch, and the truffle popcorn is enormous and the perfect snack when you've got a little buzz going on.

The atmosphere is very nice, but super loud right after work. This isn't the kind of place that I would come if you wanted to catch up with someone. It's more of the kind of place where you get quickly drunk, eat some popcorn, then leave to take a little stroll along the embarcadero. It's way too loud for a date or a catch up, but it's fine if you're just trying to grab a drink with a coworker.
author: Christina S.

description: Had our holiday party here. The food was amazing and so were the drinks. The truffle oil popcorn is amazing!
author: Zach H.

description:
Cool neighborhood bar. Came in for happy hour after walking around the city all afternoon. I grabbed a Guiness while my wife only wants hot water. Bartender was super sweet and nice and patient. 

5 stars for service and chill ambience.
author: Beer W.

description:
Taverna Aventine is like an old pair of elegant, leather driving gloves. You slip them on once in a while just for the casual elegance of wearing them, even though they seem old fashioned in these modern times ; - ) 

I've frequented this bar several times on several occasions -- the first was a toy drive for an organization that rented out the entire venue. I had the privilege of enjoyed the cave-like downstairs, which looks like a cozy, old boys smoking den. 

The second visit, I took the opportunity to sample a variety of drinks thanks to Yelp Drinks, with several members from my Young Professionals Social Group. The generous happy hour prices made the drinks much smoother and more delicious.

We sampled the Dark & Stormy, Aventine Caipirinha, and Acai Lemonade.

For my third visit, I invited a few fellow hard working board members to enjoy a few stiff drinks and savor some upscale bar bites.

When I'm back in the City, and in the FiDi, I'll stop by and slip into Taverna Aventine for another visit.

Recommendations: 
Truffled Popcorn with Parmesan and Parsley
Aventine Caipirinha
author: Diana V.

description: Love the library part of this.  We were a big group (10 + at any one time) and it provided a nice place to chat and see everybody.  Almost like being in the living room of your house.  Drinks were great.  The Venetian Sprtiz was really refreshing.  Foodwise, love their margherita pizza and thei truffle popcorn.  Can't go wrong with that.
author: Fe R.

description:
I love this place, really, I do. It's a real bar with questionable decorum and cheap beers that somehow doesn't feel seedy.

But, it always seems closed for a private event. In fact, the only two times I've intentionally gone here it's been closed. 

Still, it's awesome. And I recommend you go here. And the view and ambiance standing outside isn't so bad. Win win.
author: Alex K.

description:
I came here for lunch and the food is quick and good.
Prosciutto arugula pizza = $15
Chicken salad = $12

Quiet place to have a nice lunch at.  Very different compared to night time where it's lively and loud....maybe because everyone is drunk.
author: Melinda T.

description:
Where did all these beautiful people come from?!

I know it wasn't the dim lighting or the casual chic surroundings that upped the beauty factor in here, I was literally surrounded by aesthetically pleasing individuals. (hot eye candy!)

I didn't feel overdressed, as I tend to feel in a LOT of lounges/bars here in San Francisco.  It must've been the fact that we were here to celebrate the birthday of the fabulous Simone W or maybe because it was just another Friday night in the Fidi.  I know Taverna Aventine has kick ass happy hour, but I think I prefer it for a fun Friday night.

Great, stiff cocktails such as the Cucumber Collins (Ketel, St. Germain and cucumbers) and the Italian Spritz (prosecco, aperol, orange slice) kept me liquored up well into the night. If you're hungry, the huge $3 truffle popcorn and arugula-prosciutto pizza are sure to please. On weekends, they have a DJ that spins house/electronica than the usual Top 40's.

Wear your heels, humenah humenah dress and prepare to schmooze the whole night.
author: Janice C.

description: Great place to get a pricey drink after work. Nice low key atmosphere, wish there were more couches and few stools. Staff is friendly and efficient. Unfortunately closes a bit early when the downtown crowd filters out.
author: Boris G.

description: Very good food, poor service. They only had 1 server serving about 10 tables and the bar tender was very rude. The 2 stars is only for the service, but the food was amazing
author: Ariaha N.

description:
Great happy hour spot in the FiDi! Get there early if you want to grab a seat - they also have a few tables outside and you get a nice view of the Transamerica buliding.  

The service has been awesome every time I've been here for HH. Great drink specials, cute venue, and a nice crowd.  

You MUST order the Truffle Popcorn - it's heavenly!
author: Suki B.

description:
I have been meaning to try this place as I have heard that they have great happy hour. My coworkers and I decided to set up a trip. We went on a Wednesday at 5pm. The bar was starting to slightly fill up with three tables remaining. We had a remotely large group. Luckily, the waitress notified me that there is more seating and another bar downstairs. In the lower level, we settled into a lounging area that can seat a fair amount of people up to 6-12.
 
Drinks were six dollars for the happy hour menu which included some listed cocktails and wine that lasted until 7pm weeknights. All in which were made perfect to taste. We had no trouble ordering regardless of the hoard of people that stormed in right at 5:30pm as the place does get crowded.  
 
We ordered the chicken skewers which went well with the creamy pesto sauce. 
The salumi platter with cheese was great for a group to nibble on while sipping on the wine.  
 
Overall, I am looking forward to coming back with other friends to share another happy hour gem. Service was extremely accommodating regardless of how busy they are.
author: Becky Q.

description:
I'm going to be completely candid here and say I'm a tad bit biased because I work in the FiDi and it's close by.

But, I absolutely love this place. I can't speak for the food, but booze? Yup, gotcha covered.

I typically come for Happy Hour (5pm can't ever come soon enough). Pros are as follows:

1. Great Happy Hour prices and selection. Wine me, please. 

2. The bartenders are kinda awesome. 

3. Layout. There's an upstairs ('yeah, sure I'll mingle and pretend to like people') or downstairs ('Whoa, where are you taking me? Is this some secret dungeon?'). 

4. The chairs downstairs are so comfy (is that weird?)

5. Good for smaller groups 


If you like wine and happy hour and comfy chairs you won't be disappointed.
author: Amanda U.

description:
Scrumptious! I came here for my colleague's birthday and I was pleasantly surprised by the food! We shared everything so we could sample more dishes. Our favorite appetizer- without a doubt: the prime beef tartar. It came with a cute quail egg & we sautéed the tartar at the table. It was fun to eat and it was delicious!

The Tuscan Steak panini was really good- it came on a pretzel hoagie and it was really really good. You just need to try it! 

I usually don't eat beef - but these 2 beef dishes were incredible! I would order these 2 dishes again the next time!!!
author: Charissa N.

description: Oh how I HATE being served an adult beverage in a jelly jar. I ordered a beer and these mason jars they use (meant for preserves) are awkward to drink out of.  Also, the evening I went my "beer jar" smelled like dirty dishwater which ruined my beer. The atmosphere is very good, but otherwise it was an unpleasant drinking experience this time. Other people's cocktail drinks looked great, but my beer stunk (literally.)
author: J L.

description: This has become my go-to spot in the area. The perfect place for a drink after work. I've been to a couple of their events in the alleyway next door and they are always fun, and the bartenders are nice. Every time I would come here I would notice ppl with popcorn. I thought it was just regular popcorn ppl were having with their drinks randomly, but nope. It is truffle popcorn and it is awesome! Way better than I expected. Definitely get it. You will easily notice all other tables around you have popcorn as well. Also, there is a cool downstairs area for when it gets too crowded.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Ended up at this cute, FiDi spot for a good friends going away shindig. She rented out the bottom room which had a min bar tab I think it was $500. The place itself is very cute and has a rustic feel. There is a decent hh with food included. I believe it's until 7pm and there is complimentary cheese plates on Tuesday. I liked the upstairs decor much better but since I was there for a private party it made sense to stay downstairs.

The bar manager and bartender who was set downstairs were both super nice - huge plus! I always like when someone is easy to work with and accommodating.

We did try the buratta appetizer which was one of their more popular dishes and so delish! I'd definitely like to go back on my own for happy hour or drinks.

Definitely a solid pick for FiDi!
Mor
author: Priya S.

description:
Janice was spot on in her review of Taverna Aventine.  All the women here are unexpectedly beautiful and dressed SO well.  To make a huge generalization, I'm going to assume that it's because a lot of the population in here consists of PR / Marketing girls from Jackson Square / Levi Plaza.  Luckily, I wear heels all the fucking time, so I didn't look like as much of a troll.

Anyway, I'm not sure what Aventine is like during a regular happy hour.  For holidays like Cinco de Mayo and St. Patrick's Day, they tend to throw preeeettty sick alley parties that start at 4 pm and last for a looooonggg time + DJs + local food vendors.

I know they're going to have a Bastille Day block party in July, so be sure to check it out!  And for those of you who don't know what Bastille Day is, it's my half birthday! ... and that's all you need to know.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Drinks! And lots of them. Party for the end of our busy season. 

The bar was rented out for our tax party and it was a fun location. They made some really great drinks, but I mostly stuck with wine. 

We also go to try a lot of their appetizers as a part of their service during our party
Pigs in a blanket - Delicous. I think these were my favorite of the night. Then again, puff pastry wrapped around some sasuage is always good in my books. 
Mushroom bruchetta - A little hard to eat since it was a two bite finger food. Not too bad, but the mushrooms were just too much for me since I don't love mushrooms. 
Pizza - pretty good, but hard to eat. Kind of more like a flatbread, rather than pizza.
Ham and cheese - pretty good, but the proportion of bread to the middle was off to me.
Grilled cheese - Again, there was too much bread to cheese - wish the bread was just a little less thick. 


Regardless, amazing experience, good food and great drinks!
author: Nina Y.

description: Food was amazing (especially the Aventine Meatballs which were to die for), I would always return for the food, chill atmosphere, and the amazing service
author: Stewart K.

description: Went here for the first time for happy hour with my coworkers around 4pm on a Tuesday. Got the margherita pizza and meatballs for appetizers. Both were served very quickly and tasted great. Only hung out in the upstairs area...it was pretty busy but not overwhelming for happy hour in this area. Service was great and very accommodating for our big group. Will definitely be visiting again.
author: Moira M.

description:
Happy hour is from 3-7 weekdays and it is one of the best in the Financial District. Select glasses of wine and cocktails are $6 and there are plenty of food items to choose from. The nice thing is that the food they offer during happy hour is well priced and actually really good, including a big ass bowl of truffled popcorn for just a few bucks. Also, the Burrata is delicious.

The atmosphere is pretty cool. There is an upstairs that was pretty crowded both times that I have been and the downstairs has a really cool vibe to it with old stone walls. The crowd is mostly after work people with a few others mixed in.

All said, a group of four of us had 2 drinks each, popcorn, a pizza, burrata and bruschetta and left with a tab just over $80. Pretty good deal for a SF happy hour.
author: Frank J.

description:
This place gets CROWDED after work. Great place to come for happy hour, nice and kinda upscale. But its so hard to find a place to sit, and it gets so crowded that most people just end up standing. I think I would try to get here a little earlier next time to snag a place to sit or at least a table to stand over. As it was, we ended up sitting outside (the weather wasn't unbearable for once). Little bugs from the tree nearby kept falling down on us though, so that wasn't too nice. 

However, they have great service and good wine. Happy hour prices are ok, and their selection of wines, beers, and cocktails are pretty good. I went with the Moscow Mule and enjoyed it very much.
author: Sandy L.

description: Great drinks and a decent happy hour menu. The garlic popcorn keeps me coming back and the ladies away!
author: Hot W.

description: Come here for happy hour after work! Great staff, great drink and food menu, great interior, and during happy hour they have unlimited help-yourself snacks. Definitely my favorite place for HH in FiDi :)
author: Clay P.

description:
My coworkers come here pretty often, so I decided to check it out with them. Walking in, Taverna Aventine reminded me of a few bars in Italy. There's a mural of Rome's skyline on a wall by the staircase, followed by the cute bartenders working their magic with the patrons. 

So far, Taverna Aventine serves up a real good Sazerac here compared to some of the other bars I've been to in the FiDi vicinity. I have yet to try the food, but I'll get to that soon xD
author: Jason C. J.

description: Headed over here with a couple of friends for happy hour after we figured out the the Bubble lounge had closed. Luckily it wasn't too packed yet and we were able to grab a table for 3. The decor in here is relaxed but nice . There are only 3 happy hour cocktails on the menu. I got one with proseco, but it had a bitter after taste. I think next time I'll go with a class of wine. My friend and I also shared a bowl of their truffle popcorn and we devoured most of it - seriously, it's hard to stop eating. Overall, nice place and would be happy to go back.
author: caroline y.

description:
Nice spot out of the way. Went around 4pm, and the seating was open.
I had the truffle popcorn and pigs in a blanket. Actually. Ordered two of those.
Great quality food with a relaxed atmosphere.
author: Sean H.

description: Quite possibly the coziest spot I've been to in SF... Great happy hour menu, music and staff. The location is absolutely perfect. Looking forward to coming back very soon!
author: Christy M.

description:
I guess this place is too busy to call a customer back.  I have a going away party im trying to plan for about 20 people....and I guess this establishment has better things to do than call me back...oh did i also mention that I tried emailing them as well.

Ok...so my party of 20 will go elsewhere

Thanks for nothing
author: rin c.

description:
An okay drink spot. The scene is decent and gets a solid FIDI crowd after work but drinks are over priced & service is underwhelming. 

They also charge you for club soda, so designated drivers & sober folks beware, looks like management is trying to squeeze a bit more margin out of the bar, because poorly made $12 cocktails aren't enough.
author: Justin O.

description:
Killer food, great service. 

Their bartenders are knowledgeable about their liquors and can make one hell of a cocktail. It's great for happy hour but gets really busy (for good reason). Food is incredible every single time. They offer small bites which are great for sharing or when you just want to eat everything in sight. I've rented out their downstairs room for private events a few times- highly recommended. Reasonable minimums (especially for FiDi), full bar, comfortable/sexy lounge furniture, great ambiance. The layout works well whether you have a small happy hour or something larger
author: Adrienne H.

description:
I'm obsessed. The happy hour is so good I legitimately feel bad when I don't go. Let me explain why:

Truffle Popcorn | $3
Literally the biggest bowl of popcorn I have ever seen. AND IT IS 3 DOLLARS. I swear I could sit in that bowl and comfortably sled down a hill. Also, its absolutely delicious.

Chicken Skewers | $9
You get 4 skewers with 4 medallions each. They throw some zucchini in between the chicken to mix it up. The best part though is the Piquillo Aioli which I regretfully (I regret nothing) ate with my fork after the skewers were finished because it was that good.

Basil Cucumber Gimlet | $8
Really delicious. Can't say I tasted a lot of cucumber but it was still a damn good basil gimlet. I ended up getting 4 of them.

Definitely check it out. Seating gets kinda tough during happy hour so while you're sipping away keep your eyes peeled for any available seats and grab them!
author: Nikhil D.

description:
I just organized a happy hour here and couldn't be happier. Literally this was the only place that didn't require an absurd minimum or fee to book out an area.

We booked the front window alcove, as it didn't require a fee. It was advertised as being able to fit 30 people... but I would realistically say more like 20. Anyways, it's not a great area to stand around and chat in because it's couches and seats circling low tables. But it's a great place to put food and drinks down! Our party ended up just spreading out all over the bar, which is much more suited to standing or sitting at tables and chatting. The main bar can fit like probably 75 people or so comfortably.

Michelle, the general manager, is wonderful to work with. She's very responsive and flexible.

Their busiest times seem to be after work until about 7, then the crowd dies down a bit, which was perfect, because the people from my party started streaming in then and replacing the people leaving.

The truffle popcorn is cheap and amazing. It's not punch you in the head flavorful, but it's rich, subtle, earthy, and addicting.

The pizza is pretty good too! I liked the cheese plate and nuts as well.

I had the Manhattan here and it was quite good. The Spiced Buck with ginger beer was quite excellent as well. I'm just a giant sucker for ginger beer I think. The atmosphere and drinks at this bar are really nice and I'd totally come back just for a bar crawl with friends.
author: Michael W.

description:
This place is like my second home during the work week. Ok, ok, calm down there...I'm not a work-time alcoholic or anything ;)

There's a few reasons I love this place...

1) Happy Hour. Yes the prices raised, but it is still by far one of the BEST happy hours in the area...and on Tuesdays there's free snacks. The chips are to die for. 

2) It's fucking cute. Really. Or maybe I just have a thing for lots of wood. Again, calm down with your dirty thoughts.

3) The staff - I seriously love all these girls...and couple boys. Always cheerful, friendly, talkative, and pour a strong beverage! Michelle (if I got her name right, the manager) is like a damn ball of sunshine. Even in my most shitty of days she makes me smile and say hi...and I don't like saying hi to people. Darion (sp??), what a ball of great energy...always a party when she serves us. And pretty green eyes (I can't recall her name because I think I've lost some memory due to the amount I drink here), sweet as hell and always super friendly. 

So, if you haven't been or trying to find a place to wet the whistle (that sounds dirty...your mind can go there on this one), A is the place to go!

Drink on my fellow fidi friends!
author: Jesse V.

description:
This place has a cool vibe. I can't quite put my finger on it, but it's just a nice, mellow place to hang out & have a couple of drinks with friends. 

I visited on a recent Wednesday night, it was after happy hour & the place wasn't too crowded. My friends & I scored that great lounge area right by the front window with the great view of the Transamerica Building. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NRwDer86lrwbUkv6PhcicA?select=q__PyncZ2w50spi-PeUUlQ 

The staff was very friendly & attentive. I ordered a cosmo off their menu that was delicious. I think it was $10 which is about the going rate these days. Their truffle popcorn is pretty darned delicious too. 

I had wanted to check out the old SF sea wall that is in the downstairs parlor, but there was a private party going on so I had to skip it. I'll check it out next time, since I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Erin S.

description: Ive been here for a drink and for a very short time before trekking off to dinner. Very cool space, lots of wood, dimly lit. A solid Manhattan all around. Any place with a drink called "BRIAN WILSON'S AWESOME SHOES" which has Kettle,Oranje, Bitters, Soda, & Tang are ok in my book. You cant be too serious with something like that.
author: Kim N.

description:
I came here with co-workers and when I first walked in, it was pretty packed. I guess I'm not surprised considering that it's the Financial District. It was filled with business people and I had seen a sign outside saying there's Happy Hour. My company reserved the downstairs portion, so we had the space to ourselves. 

+Interior decor - I liked the wall paper
+Truffle popcorn
+Chardonnay (I'm not sure which one...the bar tender just gave me a couple options haha)
+Flatbread pizzas
+TVs to watch sporting games
+Good place to chill and unwind with some co-workers/friends

The upstairs was a bit loud, so definitely have that in mind if you're going on a date...might want to choose a different place where you can have a conversation without shouting or risking violating someone's space bubble!
author: Katherine S.

description:
I really want to like Aventine more becuase it is a nice space with typically good and friendly service but I never can do more than an hour or two here. The biggest drawback is that Aventine can get douchey really quick during the week.On big party nights, it can get Marina drunk. Here's what happened to me last Cinco Di Mayo, and I paraphrase of course.

Bitchy drunk Girl: "I'm drunk and I want your sombrero so you're gonna give me your sombrero."
Me: "Umm. No." 

10 Minutes later...

Bitchy drunk Girl: "I got a sombrero no thanks to you."
Me: "Umm. You're welcome." 

All things considered though, Aventine is still a decent watering hole. The drinks and servers tend to make up for the funky vibe you occasionally get from folks here. I think the optimal time to come here is just after happy hour. This way you have more room to breathe and decently catch up with friends over drinks.
author: Jon L.

description:
I joined my son and a friend here for drinks after work yesterday.  It was my first visit here.

It took a very long time for the waiter to come to the table.  The waiter was borderline rude and definitely indifferent.  I ordered my scotch and he sarcastically responded "delicioius".  Perhaps I don't meet the demographic that he prefers to patronize the establishment?

I won't return.
author: David W.

description:
We cam here for a benefit held in the private room downstairs. The private room was pretty cool, it has its own bar and the exposed brick wall is actually the original 1849 seawall. Definitely has a bit of the hideout feel to it, which suits its location in the old SF Barbary Coast. 

While we chatted and enjoyed our libations, we snacked on chicken skewers, beef sliders (the meat was so good, I swore I tasted some lamb mixed in), olive and mushroom tapenade, and crab salad over cucumber. From looking at the menu on menupage, except for the sliders, I'm not sure if the catering for our private event is part of their every day offering. I highly recommend the sliders and the mushroom tapenade was also very good. I didn't get to try it, but every time a waiter walked by carrying truffle infused popcorn for upstairs, the aroma was positively intoxicating! 

We headed upstairs to watch the conclusion of the Broncos and Chiefs game. It's nice that a yuppy-ish place like this has a few TVs hanging above the bar. The crowd was decidedly fidi, with many in suits. I suspect that it might be a bit of a meat/meet market. I really loved the lively atmosphere and can't wait to go back for happy hour and some of that truffle popcorn!
author: Alice W.

description:
Came here with a few coworkers for happy hour during Yelp week.  We had some great drinks and bites, which we needed since we had a lot of drinks.  Great service, food and atmosphere.  People are just hanging out, I love the happy hour crowd, that's social, fun and not a meat market.  

I've been here before for other happy hours, events downstairs and always had a great time.  It's definitely one of those places that is different day and night, not sure what the Sat night crowd might be like, but during the week it's a great place to have a drink.
author: Inga W.

description:
Pros: Convenience for those who work in Fidi, great happy hour wine and cocktail options (I prefer the wine here to the cocktails though), appetizing bar bites (truffle popcorn is HIGHLY addictive) and fun bartenders 

Cons: Insanely crowded during happy hour. My biggest challenge with Aventine has always been in acquiring a table or even some room to stand by the bar. It's usually a full house and completely packed. And it can get so obnoxiously loud that it's almost inaudible to hear the folks you're with. 

So I recommend coming to Aventine much later in the night than during happy hour.
author: Priya S.

description:
One of my favorite HH spots! Super close to my work and parking isnt all that bad if you go around 6pm. HH goes til 7 which is awesome. Love the burratta....wow oh wow oh woooooooooooooow! huge portion...perfect for two people to split. 
Get a pizza with that and even that may be too much for two! Was there last week and we left with two slices to spare. The Liberty is my choice for HH wine- yum! Everyone is super duper friendly that works there.........it does get busy so if someone can grab a table or spots at the bar; do it!
author: Ricquel N.

description:
I've held two events at Taverna Aventine, and both have been great. The first was an alumni mixer between two schools (with about 40 people), and we used the Library Room (free of charge) while other patrons were there. The second was a much larger event--180ish people--and we rented the entire place.

Before reaching out to Aventine about hosting our event there, I contacted about 5 or 6 other places (mostly art galleries). Many took days to return my phone calls and email, or never responded at all. Michelle, the manager, had a response to me within a few hours, and I really appreciated that. 

The manager is awesome and answered all my questions promptly. I changed our head count numerous times, including the day of the party, and she was able to accommodate all my requests and calm me down when I was freaking out about last minute details. 

The night of the party, the staff was really friendly and professional and I had SO many people come up to me, telling me how great the event was, how much they liked the bar, etc. 

Although I didn't get to drink much, the drinks I had (vodka gimlets) were exactly how I like them, and it didn't take me long at all to get the attention of the bartender. 

Overall, a really good experience and I'd definitely use them again for future events.
author: Marcella D.

description: We had called ahead for a party of 12 for a work drinks appetizer thing. We were told that they did not have dinner tables available but they would set us up with 3 tables that we could share. Once we got there, it was chaotic. The hostess seemed overwhelmed and the 3 tables they pointed us were tiny bar tables for 2 each. It would have still been ok except that there were people there and it was not clear if they wanted us to shoo them away or if they were going to. After a round of drinks and waiting awkwardly for 15 mts for the tables, we decided to leave and take our business elsewhere.  They were apologetic but this was just bad management and really annoying.  We scrambled and ended up going to Bocadillo around the corner.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Love this place! Husband and I met up with another couple for drinks and apps here on a Tuesday evening (later, post 7, so it wasn't as crowded as some of the reviews mention, although I can see that happening!) Great vibe, amazing service, and yummy food. 

I got a couple glasses of the italian spritza (prosecco, aperol, orange) which was delicious. LOVED the burrata with arugula pesto, marinated tomatoes, balsamic and crostini. Wonderfully flavored pesto and the mozzarella was to die for. I want to go back just for that. As a table, we also got one of the big bowls of popcorn (fine, too many unpopped kernels), the prosciutto wrapped shrimp (fine, nothing special, came out not quite warm enough), and the chicken parmesan sliders (tasty, but served with a side of cold picked veggies that were not very good). I'm sure this isn't common, but our waitress comped all of our drinks to hh prices, even though it was definitely past happy hour. 

We'll be back!
author: Piyali F.

description: Great happy hour deals, delicious Moscow Mule, bruschetta was good too. Don't get the pigs in a blanket unless you just plan to coat them in ketchup. I dig the decor and the staff was fairly friendly.
author: Cassie C.

description:
In logging back in here to write a review on this place I just noticed they have a downstairs and it looks super nice wish I got to see it as well. Anyway went to Aventine on about a month ago on a Saturday Night and was surprised to see that it was not that busy especially for such a cute place. I know it was kind of early and the Warriors were in the play off's so it might have had something to do with it or maybe this is more of a Happy Hour spot. 

Regardless the place was more on the upscale side and everyone was dressed to impress.  I usually don't hang out in the Financial District so not sure if that's how it is at every spot but it caught my eye. 
 I really enjoyed the décor and mood  it set. Drinks were a little price but I feel it was worth it for the setting and type of place it was. Would really like to go back for a big event.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Met my HS friend here for HH and boy it was crowded.  The crowd is fun, hip and true professionals which makes this place very inviting. 
My friend and I sat by the bar from 5 -8 and we had an awesome time! The food was good and the drinks were awesome!  I think I had 4 drinks all throughout the night which were all pretty tasty.

Well our night just didn't end there (headed to POLK ST after) but it did start out GREAT!

Thanks TAVERNA!  We will back soon!
author: Claudine V.

description: Was there recently. Off the beaten path, find Matt, Michael, or the beautiful girl. That is all.
author: Ken T.

description:
Hosting a post-work meet up that's open to women I know and don't know can be awkward in a bar...is the crowd ok, is the bar nice to groups, is there room for a group to stand together, will I look really dumb with my sign?  This all came up and went away.

The manager generously helped up find a spot to set up camp and then suggested reserving the front window seating area next time. Our waitress was friendly, returned frequently, and earned her good tip. Good HH prices, good drinks, and a good crowd.

We're coming back next month with reserved seating, but I'll come back with just a friend. It's crowded, but not painfully so, and everything I need for happy hour was there: fair pricing, good selection of specials, and friendly service. And I'll try the pop corn next time; I was wondering about that...
author: Laura A.

description:
Ive been to this place a few times and it seemed ok, however the last time i was here i had an issue with the bartender charging my tab for drinks i didnt order. (WARNING to everyone out there: DO NOT open a tab at this place, if you do be prepared to pay for things you did not order. On top of that the staff is rude and incompetent). Only after threatening to walk out and dispute the entire bill through American Express did the manager offer to correct it. That was the end of that.

But it gets worse.

NYE comes up, a friend rented out the downstairs portion of the bar and invites us to attend. I figured i would give this place another shot. But nope Aventine let me down again. When i tell the bartender to charge my drink to my credit card and close my tab (im no fool, i learned my lesson) she goes on some rampage she said, "your very rude and you better not expect speedy service" all because i didnt want to open a tab... Ive been to a million different bars in SF and around the world and have NEVER received service like this. Unfortunately it was NYE and all of my friends were there so i had to bite my tongue and  stay. Had it been any other day i would have walked out.
author: V I P.

description:
Go-to Happy Hour spot!

I used to frequent Aventine when I worked across the street at the Transamerica Center by the pyramid... a little walk through mini Redwood Park and a trot across the street- and I was there!!

The wine selection is nice, and I've enjoyed the food I have eaten here... though it has been a year or two, I can't quite remember what I had. It got super crowded the other week for the Yuppie Friday's block party and silent auction... but everyone was in good Friday spirits, friendly, and happy! It was a semi-nice day, and I had a great time mixing between the band and the outdoor bars, the downstairs bar (which I never get to experience, there are always private parties down there when I am in for Happy Hour), and the sardined inside main bar. Still, no one seemed to mind! 

I'll definitely start coming more often, since I'm not working in sunny SOMA anymore!
author: Kristin F.

description:
Great place in the financial district for happy hour! I loved the acai lemonade cocktail! Not too weak and not too strong ;).

I'm not sure if there were deals for happy hour food but I enjoyed the white pizza (brussel sprouts, fontina cheese,  carmelized onions on a flat bread). Very good portions as well (it came with two small pizzas). The truffle popcorn wad good as well but want my favorite.

Would definitely come back!
author: Christina C.

description: Classy place, good for happy hour. A bit more crowded than I might like, and the prices could be lower; especially since their specialty cocktails aren't anything special...
author: Greg F.

description:
Friday night meet up with Mr. V.
It was around 7:30 so we just missed the happy hour crowd, but there were a good amount of people out mingling that evening. We shared the combo salumi and cheese platter-amazing!! Fresh burrata, a nice pungent bleu, and creamy goat cheeses served with lavender honey, pickled veggies, olives, candied ginger, and artisan meats. We also ordered the prawn skewers.

We ordered two rounds of cocktails before heading off to the next destination. The staff was slightly aloof. It took us  awhile to flag down our waitress and we ended up just walking over to the bar to order(we were seated at one of the small tables) I highly recommend the cucumber collins. Mr. V really enjoyed the passion fruit caphirinha
I must return with the ladies for happy hour. . . . .
author: Kia B.

description:
A good place for happy hour when the weather is great.  3.5 stars.

Good beers, good service, and good finger foods/appetizers.  I like all of the beers here, and their pizzas really are quite good.  But stick to beer and pizza, as you might be disappointed if you venture beyond that.
author: Mark M.

description:
Truly impressed with our lunch at Taverna Aventine from the service to the simple menu.  I wanted the beef sliders but out came the chicken sliders which was fine because I wasn't sure which to go for.  I'm gluten-free and severely allergic so no buns for me and the chicken had melted mozzarella or provolone, marinara sauce and a touch of basil.  I asked for bacon so the tender chicken was topped with bacon that criss-crossed and made for a beautiful presented lunch alongside some pickled vegetables.  My gentleman friend ordered the grilled chicken, potato and white bean salad.  He was super stoked.  My Mimosa was fine but hid grapefruit mimosa rocked our worlds!  Note to self... orange juice and sparkling wine is so yesterday.  

We ran into a bunch of friends visiting from Carmel on a work field trip here checking out the bar scene... such a weird coincidence and such a small world.
author: Shiho F.

description: A nice meeting here in the afternoon. Good Negroni. Arrive well before the bankers quit work if you want to sit.
author: Philip S.

description:
One of my favorite happy hour spots! Great atmosphere, great location. Awesome HH specials and food!

I work in Potrero Hill and this is a great location wherever you work. 

Friendly staff, hip vibe. This is a MUST SEE. 

My recommendation: popcorn & wine! :)
author: Heather H.

description:
Friday 2/17 around 3-5pm. The two bartenders that worked behind the bar were awesome. Quick, funny and professional. 

Unfortunately my rating of the place downgraded to a one because of a waitress that acted in an incredibly unprofessional manner, slamming things down on our table, trying to make a point of wanting us to leave, and clearly talking about our table with other customers. I'm sorry, was our $150 tab not good enough to treat us with a little respect? For such a well established, specialty bar with unique drinks, I think they are doing themselves a great disservice for having an employee such as that woman work as the face of the establishment. 

Great drinks, beautiful interior, but really terrible vibe with the kind of presence the waitress gave off. I may sound like a bitter costumer but given that I was a server for 2 years, this was a huge negative. And in this economy, management should really reconsider their employment. Service is EVERYTHING nowadays.
author: Yunah R.

description:
One of my favorite spots for a low-key evening of drinking and hanging-out.

Perfectly located in Jackson Square, this place has a cool maritime/pirate theme, but with a cool and modern twist.  While there are two levels (main floor level and downstairs), it can get packed if there are other events going on or if it happens to be a busy night.  

It's great to spend the afternoon walking around North Beach, walking through Jackson Square and then having pre-dinner drinks at Aventine.

Really a great spot.
author: Ken G.

description:
Review is only for the upstairs bar & atmosphere.

We came for a HH kick-off drink before heading off elsewhere.  Got there early so got a seat at the bar and chatted it up over drinks.  I can't remember exactly what it was, but got a fruity cocktail -- with acai I believe.. and it was rather delish.  I was happy with it and how empty it was at 5pm, and then slowly filled up.  It gets busy!

Unfortunately didn't see downstairs, but was pretty happy with what I saw upstairs.  I like the dark wood .. charming! The few tables outside also seem cool if you want something a bit more mellow and are catching up with just one friend.  I'd go back - good location for a meetup spot for people working on market vs. up at levi's plaza.

 Didn't feel right to say "Yay I like it" when I only spent about 20 minutes there. Perhaps next time I'll get a chance to see downstairs and try some food and upgrade to a 4.
author: Melody T.

description:
Below is a summary of an unpleasant experience I had at Aventine last night.  This fits in with a number of other reviews about poor management and service at Aventine also posted on Yelp.  I hope this perspective leads the owners to deal with the situation. 

1.  group gathered by the bar.  other group by the tables.  people circulating between the two.  natural behavior in a bar.  

2.  group of folks joins us from outside tables.

3.  waitress trying to pass through, without asking excuse first in a polite voice, yells in a shrill voice, very rude.  "move!!!!!"  her behavior continues each time she passes through, 4 - 5 times.  all in the shrill voice, never a reasonable request.  "hey, buddy", "out of my way!!!" so loud, shrill and out of line that everyone is commenting.  it is noted that all of us have been to other establishments where the passage situation is also delicate, and the staff manages to handle it in a more constructive, hospitable way.  

4.  it is also noted that this waitress was extremely impatient with the guests when taking their orders outside.  to the extent that people said, "who is the customer here?"

5.  annoyed at being yelled at by the staff for an innocent situation, i spoke to the bartender who identified himself as the night's manager.  i said, "you should know about this.  it is a problem.  everyone is talking about it.  i understand this is a difficult situation, but her behavior is out of line."

6.  the manager is completely unsympathetic.  not respecting my opinion at all, the manager says, "yeah, well it is a tough job."

7.  the next time the waitress passes through she spills a drink on my friend.  after spilling the drink on my friend, instead of apologizing, she laughs, as if my friend deserved it.  with no apology, or acknowledgement that this is an awkward situation, the waitress walks off. 

8.  ten minutes later, the same co-manager to whom i had spoken earlier and another co-manager come by our group.  they confront my friend in a very accusatory manner and say, "our staff is downstairs crying.  what did you do to her?"  interesting way to bring up an issue with a customer.  when my friend says, "i didn't do anything" (which is true), the new co-manager says "now i have heard her version, i just want to hear your version of the story."  having already brought the waitress' attitude problem up with the other co-manager, thinking that would have tipped him off that maybe his staff isn't always right, i stood up for my friend.  i again said that the waitress was out of line and that they should do something about it. 

9.  situation seems to calm down.  crowd thins.  i am now standing by the tables.  

10.  ten minutes later, first co-manager to whom i had originally spoken approaches me.  i think perhaps he is coming to apologize for the confusion.

11.  instead, he says, "i'm sorry but we will no longer serve you or anyone in your group here.  you have been cut off.  i need to stand by my server."

12.  when i say that is a very odd way to handle a situation, the co-manager says, "i'm sorry but i don't have time to deal with this situation now.  you can come back monday and discuss this."  he then walks off.

is this the standard of hospitality i should expect from aventine?  is the market for waitstaff so tight in san francisco that we should all put up with being pushed around and accused by staff?  is management of aventine so difficult, so stretched that constructive comments to management are not respected?  

my experience at other bars, restaurants, and music venues is very different.  is this just a fact of life when i want to go to aventine on a friday night?

note to owners, the attitude and response i got from your staff was way out of line, unsympathetic, and disrespectful-- remarkably bad.
author: Katherine C.

description: Went here for a private party.  They served us the apps off their menu and they were delicious, every one.  Two kinds of sliders.  House bar tenders served up an excellent Manhattan.  Good lighting, all-around happiness.
author: Orion P.

description:
Last night was Fri the 13th, but in France it's technically already July 14th (French National Day)... Bastille Day... and what better way to celebrate it SF-style then at Aventine! 
I felt like a tourist when I felt completely enamored by the crowded alley of beautiful people overlooking the infamous Transamerica Pyramid... totally fun scene. I've never been there when the party extends out to the alley; I'm just thankful that he found me..
It was an amazing night... DJs both inside & outside... So much fun dancing! And the crepes... fresh crepes made to order.... yummmm!
author: Myra M.

description:
Friendly service, good drinks, and great food for a bar! 

Definitely recommend their truffle popcorn. The portion was the size of a small bathtub, and for only $4! No complaints here.
author: Stefi C.

description:
The location is really nice.  That is the only good thing about this place. 

My friend recently had an event here for her husband's MBA party. The waitstaff is rude, the bartenders ignore you, and they do not even attempt to sympathize with you.  We arrived about 1/2 hr after the start time and the place was closed. No call from the management or anything.

They probably get away with their poor courtesies because the location provides them with all the revenue they need so they do not care about customer service.

If you just want a beer and people watch this is fine. Otherwise, skip it.
author: Meybel C.

description:
Used to suggest this as a spot for first dates, but now I don't want to run into them there if the date goes poorly.

Just a fun spot!  Great deals for HH, lots of finance-types blowing off steam after work.  Fun to chat with the bartender and a friend on a Monday or collect business cards for future dates on Fridays.

Beer and wine selections are totally adequate and it's not that expensive for fidi.  Food is fine as well and I like that it sticks with just being bar bites.
author: Bailey D.

description: Love this bar! Great place, great drinks, awesome food! The best financial district bar I can find!
author: Lisa L.

description:
I've tried. Really I've tried. I just can't handle it for large events. The word homogeneous just kept repeating loudly inside my head like a fog horn.  

It looks charming....too bad I can't ever pick the right time to go. Small groups seem to be the best way to navigate Aventine for a great experience. 

I'll go back for the more low-key events. Or on a regular evening for post-work happy hour drinking.
author: Jay H.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the FiDi for happy hour. I've also been here for lunch a few times and their food is really good. The Tuna Tartare is fresh and light, with a little spiciness but not too much. My friend had the burger and really enjoyed it. 

If you come here for drinks try ordering the popcorn with truffle oil, it's delicious!
author: amy k.

description: Oh.my.goodness!! The white pizza and the beet salad was amazing. The beet salad included tons of golden and red beets with a honey vinaigrette - completely tasty!' Thank you for being a perfect casual lunch place :)
author: jeannie l.

description: Awesome spot for HH!  This is equal parts cool bar and equal parts great restaurant.  The bartenders are refreshing in that they appear to be enjoying themselves when they're making drinks. I always have a fun time at Aventine.  The best ever is when they host a "block party" and set up the adjacent ally with bars, djs and even a food truck or two.  The crowd is always lively and they do a great job with security and keeping an eye on capacity.
author: Ronita J.

description:
Happy Hour here is Happy HOURS.

I like.

My friend got carded here.

She likes.

A $6 glass of bubbly during happy hour is a generous pour.

We like.

The living room like seating area in the front window complete with couches, bookshelves, and piano.

We like.

The token you get for each drink (4 = a free drink!).

We like.

The dress to impress, yuppie, after work, vaguely Marina-ish crowd and the vibe that goes with it.

Meh.

(But it won't keep me from coming back!)
author: Amy C.

description:
Taverna Aventine is really fun all the time and was particularly fun when they had the BRILLIANT idea to throw a street party for Marti Gras! Drinking margaritas outside (even if it is sprinkling) is ALWAYS more fun then drinking inside. 

The margaritas were really good too! And the music was fun... and my pinata "friend" was fun... and the crowd was good (as it is every time!)... and my drinking buddies were the best (as always!)... and overall, it was another great night at Taverna Aventine... at least until the next morning!
author: Meghan P.

description: Great food and great atmosphere. The decor is simple yet elegant and trendy. The food is very flavorful. All of this is complemented by the great staff. This is also a great place to grab a drink after work.
author: Ricardo M.

description:
I just hosted my team party at Taverna Aventine last night and want to say that this venue exceeded all of my expectations. The level of service was outstanding from the very beginning. 

Michelle, the general manager, is knowledgeable, accommodating and a pleasure to work with. Really, she's fabulous! We were able to do a bulk of our planning via email, but when I needed to stop by in person a few times, Michelle always made herself available, so that she could answer my questions. She provided a great proposal that fit within my budget. She was helpful in the meal planning, ensuring that we had a diverse offering that was also sensitive to dietary restrictions. The food is delicious! The wild mushroom & truffle cream bruschetta was one of my favorites. During our event, appetizers were offered at the bar and also served by wait staff throughout the venue.
