I would also like to say thank you to our main server Darianne and to our bartender Daniel for taking such good care of everyone throughout the event. Michelle also was there, checked in with me regularly throughout the party and also tended to our guests. We also had a doorman manage a guest list and ensure that the general public did not come in. It was rock star service all around!  

Taverna offers the flexibility to open up space or keep the existing tables and chairs and also offer DJ equipment, as well as the option to play personal play lists or pipe in Pandora. We were able to set up a photo booth and project the pictures onto their TV screens. This was a big hit for my team and will make it one of our most memorable parties in 2013. 

We booked the main parlor upstairs. This is a great space for intimate gatherings of 90 or less. The setting really enhanced the experience for my team and they absolutely loved the setting of the venue. I would recommend this venue to anyone planning a team party or simply as a casual spot to go for drinks with friends.

Thank you Taverna Aventine

#tavernaaventine
author: Justine P.

description:
Continuing my quest for a better lunch break I ended up on the other side of the Transamerica at Taverna Aventine. Outside is clean with a pleasant little alley down the side. Since I go to lunch at one there was only two other people in the bar which made service rather good. I sat at the bar and ordered a Jack and Coke (that was a little light on the Jack) while I reviewed the delicious looking menu.

I ordered the Tuscan Steak sandwich that comes with a little salad and potatoes chips on the side. I was looking forward to the chips as they were not your everyday average Ruffles but they tasted so stale I didn't eat them. The salad was fine and the steak was soft and juicy but the bread was so hard that I couldn't eat it. Don't get me wrong, I like hard crunchy toasted bread. Even over toasted and a little burnt and crunchy is perfered but this was uneatable. After my warm steak slices I had a shot of Fernet-Branca to wash it all down.

I won't be back anytime soon for fear of rocks posing as bread may be used again. Maybe its better after dark.

Total disappointment: $32.00.
author: Justin S.

description: Great service, good people, food, excellent location, and nicely appointed.
author: Adam X.

description:
Went here for happy hour the other day, and will be back soon! Great for when you want to unwind after work, and have a classy and casual drink, or even drinks before a night out. I love the atmosphere of this place, and the place itself is in great company (Transamerica building, Bubble Lounge, etc.). 

Can't wait to visit again and try the food!
author: Bridget B.

description: This place is great for a small group for after-work happy hour. The truffle popcorn is divine and their moscow mules aren't shabby. Totally a meat market--everyone eyes you up and down when you walk in/about. Good for an ego boost!
author: Ashlee C.

description:
A warm Friday evening in April was the juncture of my inaugural visit to this bar. It was packed inside (which I figure is typical of a Friday anywhere), but thankfully going downstairs revealed a bit more space. It was pretty dim-lit and crammed but there was just enough room to get over to the bar and order.

The bartender was cool and readily recommended a few of the local brews to me. Of course, a few tips we're in order as he continually provided quick service to my coworkers and me.

There was limited seating in the basement, but I still had a great time just standing and talking with my Lagunitas IPA in hand.  If I'm ever in the SF area again, I'll be sure to go back.
author: Mark L.

description: Ehhh... a 3.5 star rating that pushes it over to 4.  They really need to get more seats up in this joint.  It's a nice enough bar, and when I walked in around 6:30 to meet some friends, I definitely took in how crowded the place is.  Oye, not a relaxing happy hour vibe.  Around 7ish though, the crowd began to dissipate, and when it's not packed, it's a pleasant bar with good drinks and good ambiance.  Maybe avoid the happy hour right after work rush, and it should be okay.  Good location, too.
author: Mel G.

description:
Great atmosphere, rustic without being overly pretentious, well maybe just a little.  Happy hour specials are good... I love Scotch, wine and beer and they had all three on special so great for me.  Don't worry I did not have all three.  The truffle butter popcorn is bomb and cheap.  

It can get pretty crowded and the scene is definitely the yuppy financial district type, but I don't discriminate ;)

There's a also a downstairs area with a full bar which has a more moody setting to it.  Overall a great place to meet friends for a drink and catch up if you're in the area.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Went here for drinks apres-dinner. I love the outdoor setting. Luckily it was a warm night. The DJ played good music. Drinks are alright, averagely priced.

Nice chill place with a beautiful view of the Transamerica building :)
author: Kinjal S.

description:
Came here for a mid-week lunch with a friend. We were able to walk right in and pull up a table around 1pm. Despite the crowd being limited to a few occupied tables of two, and several singles at the bar, the waitress seemed flustered and took a bit of time getting to our table for drink orders. She turned out to be very sweet however, and I got the overall impression that the staff is friendly and treats its customers well.

I had the Tuscan Steak Sandwich, and it was good enough. I was expecting the hoagie to taste a bit more like a pretzel (given the description) and was disappointed it didn't have the same softness and saltiness of an actual pretzel. But the steak itself was tender and the Gorgonzola aoli was delicious. It overpowered the truffle honey, however, and I even expected they forgot to put that on all together. 

My friend got a soup and salad combo. He didn't say anything exceptional about it, but he finished half if not most. He had 2 glasses of wine and I had 2 beers, and with tip we spent $30 each. Not bad at all. Overall, its a cute spot with a decent lunch menu across the foot of the Trans America building.

Worth putting on the standby list for lunch if you work downtown.
author: Raquel C.

description: The rosemary drink was absolutely delicious. It is a must try for girls. It is a good place for dates because it is not very crowded and noisy.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Came here for their HH during the Yelp Drink Week for their super cheap drinks.  

It has an older crowd so my 22-yr old self felt a bit like an outcast, but the drinks helped with that.  Ordered the Acai Lemonade, Aventine Caipirinha, and Dark & Stormy.

Acai Lemonade was stronger than I thought it'd be, could definitely taste the alcohol even though it was sweet.  The Caipirinha tasted like juice and Dark & Stormy tasted like ginger but it was probably my fave out of the three even though I don't usually like ginger.

Overall, I had a fun time and it was a good experience, but there's really nothing here that would make me want to come back.
author: Jane N.

description:
Bartender was the most wonderful, affable, efficient barkeep I've come across in...ever?  I wanted to tip her all of my money, she was so good, but I couldn't because then I'd have no money left with which to buy more from her which is what I wanted to do all day.  Incredibly accommodating and anticipating of needs for an event I attended (that had an admittedly rowdy crowd).  

Taverna Aventine, just the best!
author: Karin X.

description:
I'm a big fan of this place for a couple reasons.

On a recent work happy-hour we had a colleague faint. The genuine concern of the staff went beyond what many may have expected as their duty. Helpful and compassionate and we all really appreciated it.

In addition, the service was very good in a situation that was not easy for a server to deal with. The appetizers were pretty solid as well. 

I'm looking forward to returning to Aventine the next time I'm in SF!
author: Jayson H.

description:
I've been here once for a birthday party around 7pm... 
They reserved the table in the front and it really feel like we had a private party.. 
Happy hour food are quite tasty.. love their popcorn.  Of course there are a lot of drinks.    A lot of people(friday) enjoyed their happy hour around the bar.  Good atmosphere.  Definitely a cool - just hanging out place for a birthday!
author: Jo L.

description: Good drink specials during HH, nice atmosphere. Service was amazing. We were there for a mixer and there was probably 40+ of us and the waitress broke up all of tabs so we didn't have to sit there and figure out who owed who what.
author: Rowena L.

description:
Best Grilled Ham-n-Cheese sandwich I've had.  Comes with pickled veg and a scoop of couscous.

TA did a nice job renovating and dressing their new-old space.  The alley alongside it, Hotaling, was the waterline where the Bay once met land.

TA is the perfect place to warm up on a typically chilly San Francisco day, or eve.
author: Cathy K.

description: I went here on 8-28-14 8:40pm'sh.  It's an open bar/appetizers event.  I had two guiness beers, Moscow mule, mojito, and a Aventine cocktails, surprisingly the mixed drinks were very good.  They were giving away cowboy hats, scarves, wine bottles, etc.  Dj played some good music in the background, downstairs there were 2 gambling tables with chips/cards.
author: Jer W.

description:
The space is really cool..I like that it has a bar upstairs and downstairs. The bartenders were pretty hot..and nice, too. 
I will definitely check it out again during a week night and see what the vibe is like...
author: Mimi T.

description:
a new favorite happy hour bar! I was enjoy a martini downstairs, with like a billion olives, when a friendly gentleman started to joke with me. Turned out he was one of the designers of the place who used to be an art director back in the day. Eduardo was his name. Once I said I, too, was in advertising and there with my coworkers, he was very excited. He really wanted to meet some of our art directors (like they are some kind of near-extinct animal or something) so we brought him over to the table. Next thing you know, shots of a drink named after our agency. Tequila and oranges...delicious. 

Loved the cool downstairs area on a hot day, and liquor lockers...ingenious!
author: Nikki M.

description:
The space here is absolutely gorgeous - I'd give a million stars if I could. This is a great place for business drinks and happy hour and maybe even a first date. The downstairs is super cozy too --- lots of sitting space (not so much upstairs/groundlevel) --- and good for more of an intimate conversation or experience. The upstairs can get uncomfortably crowded so definitely find the stairs and head down, baby, down!

I look forward to stopping by here again sometime soon.
author: Meredith R.

description:
Yummy drinks
Decent HH prices
Seats!
Good service
Yummy truffle oil popcorn
Parking is easy around here around 5:30 to 6pm

What's not to like about this place?
author: Eva Y.

description:
I liked this bar and the set-up. I was even able to find a couple of seats at the bar! Which doesn't happen to often. lol. Was right by the tv too! :-D

Two words: Acai Lemonade!!! 

This is where my roommate and I started off our glorious bar hopping with the Yelp Drinks! 2011 specials. And after a few Acai Lemonades we were feeling good and feeling great! The Aventine Caipirinha was also rather interesting. I had one of those to see how it was. 

This place is cool, but I felt like the crowd wasn't really my type. (shrug) I might go back though, since it wasn't to far away.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Aventine + Happy Hour = one happy gal! 

Has a lovely wine selection,happy hour specials, friendly bar staff, and attracts a beautiful crowd :)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Came across this little spot on a Saturday. Not their busiest day due to the location but the vibe was still great! The bartender was friendly and the bruschetta was amazing! Will definitely try this place during the week for happy hour!
author: Katherine E.

description: Super - good place for imbibing in good taste, and the food as well.  Not only are the personnel very hospitable and caring, they probably also know about the Guelphs and Ghebellines (sp?) in the old days.  As in an area of S.F. that has lots of history behind it, this place is quite an establishment and fits hand in glove with local atmosphere, hospitality environment, native friendliness; and forget here that Columbus and Broadway stuff.  Really nice.  Bravo!
author: Thomas H S.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening, and happened upon Aventine's block party!  Big fan of the bar upstairs - even though it looks crowded they take care of everyone and the drinks are well made. 

With drinks in hand, my gf and I stood by the bar people watching. Hands down, this is the best spot in SF for good people watching!  That is, if you like to look at all the beautiful people :)

Didn't make it in time for the happy hour, but sure will be back to try it.
author: s m.

description: We booked the downstairs for a joint birthday party and had a wonderful time.  Big shout out to Michelle at Taverna Aventine helped plan the event and was so helpful.
author: Terence F.

description:
It felt like an old school business lunch. Walk into a bar, pull up a stool at the counter and shout "bartender, get me a......water." 

Such is the business lunch in 2010.

Good thing I wasn't coming for a drink, but instead the eats. And let me just say if the drinks are as good as the food, this place is a winner. My roasted chicken breast and apples salad was excellent. Usually you don't get enough of one or the other, in this case, there was plenty of each, including a few grapes. Admittedly most salads I order without dressing need a bit of something. This one was seriously tasty enough dry.

All enjoyed in a nicely wood accented environment with that perfect blend of modern vs. rustic decor. Service was friendly.

I'd come back for another salad. I'm definitely come back for a drink.
author: Jason B.

description:
Props to Aventine for hosting the WGIRLS Bay Area holiday celebration last night and for having Flor de Cana rum on the shelf!  The bartender was amazing and everyone was enjoying themselves.  How could you not, the atmosphere is divine.  

Upstairs and downstairs areas with dim lighting and comfy seating,  make this a cozy spot for happy hours on a cold winter night.  

Yummy bar bites... I had the bruschetta topped with mashed olives and white beans, which was delectable! 

Looking forward to coming back...
author: Michele O.

description:
I've been wanting to check out Aventine since they opened and finally had a chance last Friday night. I liked the low lighting and all of the wood. We didn't eat but liked our bottle of Valley of the Moon. We were hesitant to order it, but they did have one wine on tap(!), which is bad for me to know exists because that would be a dangerous item in our house ("I know it's only 10:30 am, but this comes out so much faster than water from the fridge filter"). 

I'll be looking for an excuse to go back.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
Wow, I can't believe that nobody has reviewed this place yet.  I have only had drinks at the bar, so this review is not about the food.  But...

One of the bartenders is nice (the tall female one), the others are standoffish and aloof.  Just yesterday had a PYT wiff an attitude charge me eleven dollars for a shot of Patron reposado in a standard sized shot glass.  WAY overpriced.  And dis was at 5pm, which is happy hour in most peoples' books.  So Papi whip out a twenty wiff a twinkle in his eye, down da shot, and give her a buck.  I think it irked her dat he didn't blink and it ain't no thang to a pimp.  Next time I'm going to Kell's.
author: Dave N.

description:
Been here before for a happy hour fundraiser - meh, don't remember the drinks being too great and the service was bad.  Super crowded, and not worth it.

But my review here is for my recent lunch experience:

Came here early with 2 coworkers and we were told we could sit anywhere.  The tables are all small and very high so the chairs are all stools with no backing.  But, unlike Bocadillos, they had no hooks on the walls so, for the ladies, be prepared to put your purse on the grimy floor or eat with it on your lap.

Menu: very limited - for all my vegetarian friends...this is NOT the place to go.  You will have a choice of one sandwich or a salad.  But while I opted for the sandwich, (the ONE and only vegetarian option), I was told there was no burrata.  It's a tomato and burrata sandwich. 

Drinks: If you're thinking 11:30 on a work day is too early to start drinking alcohol and you want perhaps a cup of coffee to go with your meal on this cold San Francisco day, THINK AGAIN.  Aventine does not serve hot beverages.

To summarize: uncomfortable seating options, no hot beverages, I had the tomato and (provolone) sandwich - which was actually pretty tasty -  the food took wayyy too long (considering we were the only ones waiting for food), and to top things off there are so many gnats flying around.  

Um, no thank you.
author: Alvina W.

description:
Suits.  If you're not wearing one, you're not in the group that goes here.  If you like places where people in suits are the norm, maybe you'd like it.
Their happy hour special beer is a fairly boring lager in a can for $3.
author: Kev M.

description: One bathroom at busy happy hour when there is one downstairs, but no one is allowed to use=Not cool! Turned into 6 person wait. But I like grabbing a drink here when it's not busy.
author: Steph A.

description:
Love this place for happy hour. It is much classier than our typical haunt, Shroeder's; sometimes, it is nice to mix it up. The happy hour drinks are reasonably priced and their lamb sliders are definitely to die for. 

If you have a big group, I would suggest heading over to their downstairs area where there is another bar, tables and stools, and a more intimate atmosphere. Upstairs, you'll find groups of FiDi workers in groups with their co-workers gabbing over drinks. I have found that Aventine can get really crowded for Friday happy hours, but it's always fun. You'll probably run into someone you know if you went to Cal. When I feel like classing it up, I head over to Aventine!
author: Angela L.

description: Happy hour on beer and on a great wine selection all night on Tuesdays? Complimentary cheese and truffle popcorn? Yes. Yes. Yeeesssss please. Love this place after work. Gets busy for a bit but not overwhelming. Great to chat with other patrons too! Every night has something fun going on.
author: Mindy M.

description:
What's not to love about an upscale looking place with dim enough lighting to make file betches and title tarts look attractive to tired jr. associates and second year analysts.

Throw in the odd duck old man in a suit without a tie that introduces himself as Bruce Wayne (I can't make this up!) and a good time is had by all.
author: Poppy C.

description:
I feel like if I had been to this place multiple times or stayed longer my review would be even lower (and angrier, like many of the others), but it was actually so crowded that I just took shelter on a couch in the corner with a couple friends and then left after an hour or so. 

If you're thinking about having a company party here just because you and your girlz/boyz like to come here and get drunk by yourselves on the weekends, DON'T. The acoustics are so bad that even with a small group of people (25-ish) the sound is deafening.
author: Avery S.

description: be cautious when paying with your credit card to the bartender!  twice we closed our tab and they forgot to give our credit card back!  not only did they do this to us, but to a friend as well who happen to be at the same party.  we made numerous attemps to get a hold of them to discuss the issue of not getting our cards back upon closing tabs and still have not heard from anyone... we had to cancel our credit cards!
author: Kae B.

description:
One of my fav places in the city...not just for HH or their alley parties but came here for lunch w/ clients (who knew they had lunch!?) and will definitely be back!

I heard from a friend that if you sit on the lounge by the window upstairs and look up, you see the transamerica building in a whole 'nother light...awesome view!

Had the tuna tartare (w/ pine nuts!), highly recommend the strawberry arugula salad, and salami plate. They even have coconut juice and their prices are very reasonable.

See you soon Aventine!
author: Betty H.

description:
Pros:
Great space for a quick drink, meeting a friend, and I even had my birthday party here!  Very chic while still being cozy, the downstairs is really cool and it has a great vibe.  Good spot to take someone for a meeting also. Food menu could be more extensive but they have some good bites, mainly drinks.

Cons:
If it gets crowded, it hits you in two places: long bathroom lines (please install another one!), and slow bar service.

Fun:
If they do an outdoor block party, you better make it.  Somehow they have a deal with the ecosystem and the sun always shine (often unseasonably for San Francisco) for a Friday afternoon/evening block party at Taverna Aventine.
author: Mike G.

description:
I recently held a wine tasting and silent auction fundraiser at Aventine, and it was the perfect venue for our event!  The manager I worked with - Tahra - was SO helpful and accomodating when working with us to make our event a success.

The food at Aventine is INCREDIBLE.  I had the pizza with buratta and pancetta and absolutely loved it.  Everything else that passed by looked great as well.

I would recommend Aventine to everyone...check it out!!
author: Christine T.

description: Came here for a private event for my friend's company that he was working for (eventbee).  Enjoyed a lot of the free champagne and gin/tonics that I got, the bottom floor was cozy and I liked the ambiance.  Don't know how my review would change if I had to pay though... so make sure to take it with a grain of salt!
author: Robert C.

description:
02.12.10 Update

I fall in love with Aventine more and more each time I go.  Sure, the drinks are pricey after happy hour.  But it's made with love, just the way you like it.

Sample scenario:
Me: do you have the iced-tea infused vodka?
Bartender: let me check.

Few moments later:
Bartender: no, it looks like we stopped carrying that.  It didn't sell too well for us.
Me: sad face.  I really wanted it.  They never have it.  That's where I discovered the drink!

Few moments later:
Me: how well do you make a gin gimlet?
Bartender: how do you like it?  Strong, limey, however you want it, I'll make it for you.

Mm hmm.

P.S. - during happy hour (M-F, 3-7), be sure to ask for tokens with every drink.  Every four tokens get you a FREE drink!

Imbibe away.
author: Jenny L.

description: Came here on a Wednesday after work and this place was packed (there was a private event downstairs). It definitely has a lively vibe to it.  Even though they were completely busy, the bartender gave us attention almost immediately and we were able to order both food and drink right away. Great service and atmosphere! Food was reasonably good, the slider was a bit over cooked but still had good flavors.  For "happy hour" I think one could find better deals in SF but possibly with less personality.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Great drinks, nice happy crowd.  I'll do it again, for sure.
author: Michael J.

description: Great for Happy Hours!  The upstairs portion near the bar is a little small and cozy, but if you like the company you're with, you won't mind!  Try the cucumber gimlet!
author: Carli F.

description: I went here last night for the block party! It was so much fun! Such a great atmosphere!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I went here for the second time today for lunch and had an amazing burrata. Drizzled with olive oil and rock salt, the arugula salad and crostini that came with it were a perfect pairing. I ordered the chicken salad with apple and endive and was pleasantly surprised by the fresh grilled chicken. Light dressing but very flavorful.
My client ordered the Italian sandwich and is was HUGE. She had to take the other half in a box.
This is a great place for a casual chic lunch in the fi-di. Service was prompt and courteous and the atmosphere is comfortable. Dark wood, high ceilings and a mini lounge area with a couch and low chairs.
Will definitely be coming back!
author: Sara D.

description:
Taverna Aventine is a great place to hit up in the Finacial District for several reasons.  The space attracts many young professionals after work which makes for a great energy of people who get their stuff done, and a consistent happy hour crowd.  I have wandered into TA on many random after work excursions and found like-minded workforce souls relieving the pressures of the day over a tasty beverage. 

Which brings me to my next point, the prices during happy hour are completely reasonable for the sophisticated feel of the place.  They have pretty neat options for your wine if you are a wine snob.  You can rent a space downstairs for your own special wine to wait for you next time you visit Taverna Aventine.  Quite the impressionable thing to throw out there if you're into that. 

Areas for feedback- Well, like most places in the Financial District it pretty much dies out past 9. (Including during the weekends).  And there is only one bathroom for the entire place.  Makes for some tense moments when there is a line.  

All in all, this is one of my favorite places to go after work and want to stay near the office.
author: Jessica G.

description: I came over from the east bay to meet a friend after work for a great happy hour spot.  The wine was reasonably priced but the food was extremely disappointing.  The popcorn came or cold and slightly soggy.  The sliders were overcooked with a stale cold bun.  The shrimp skewer were also overcooked.  Too bad.  It's a really cozy bar, but bad appetizers are unforgivable in SF, especially if you only have a few options.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Cool spot. Maybe TOO cool. Good chance you will find a good looking crowd with some of the customers thinking they are VERY cool.   

However, the bartenders weren't pretentious. On my next visit maybe I will be labeled cool.
author: Roger H.

description: Cool place for sure. I went to a private party downstairs to celebrate one of my friends and I had a great time. My issue was that it was so extremely hot and I felt like I couldn't breathe. I think I would come back to enjoy the upstairs, and the champagne is good too.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
was wondering where to go after work...and then we thought HERE!!
walked in and belled up to the small BUT sweet bar and the bartender was so.....um.....nice and charming!!! Asked me what I would like to drink and told him what I wanted, he spoke to me like we were good long lost friends.....we chatted nice and laughed, it was nice to TALK to a bartender who is nice. I  watched him served others guests that walked in and he was very welcoming. So I felt warm and welcome...his vibe was "Welcome!!" I would and will go back.....I have not yet try their food...but I will letcha know...this place was very VERY!!!!! I like
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
I love Aventine.  It makes you feel like you've stepped back into lost old world. I love places that have a great concept and design.  Located in Jackson Square, Aventine brings back the rich history of San Francisco hundreds of years ago. 

There are two levels to Aventine, so make sure that you make it downstairs, because that is where the action is. 

Liquor lockers are available downstairs to store your bottles. It's those little touches and attention to detail that make this place charming.  

Vintage 415 continues to bring the best to the bay.
author: Sandy C.

description: I work up the street, and I vacillate between Bocadillo and Aventine as my go to, "stress relief" lunch spots. I adore Amber @ Aventine- she never fails to amuse + take care of the entire lunch crowd, all the while never pretending that we're not IN A BAR for lunch on a school day.  I go to a bar for lunch on a Tuesday on purpose- duh! Not only, but also, the food is solid- I love the Tuscan Steak Sandwich on pretzel hoagie w/ truffle honey and gorgonzola.  Did I mention IT'S A BAR? All day happy hour for regulars, laid back, sit where ya like atmosphere. Thank Jeebus!
author: David M.

description:
I'm excited to write a review that includes experience with the food and service, although I have a few comments about the space as well.  My lunch experience today teeters between 3 and 4 stars - it's a new spot, so they are receiving benefit of the doubt that the kinks of today will be worked out.

The space is quite beautiful, nicely decorated - a bit Fish and Farm, a touch of Alembic and a dash of Bourbon and Branch.  The dining chairs are large and wooden.  As an average height woman, I felt swallowed by the chairs and my butt hurt after 10 minutes, but they look cool, so I guess that counts for a lot.  The space is also a bit loud, construction noises excepted.  When I send people out on business lunches, they like places on the quieter side, so we'll need to investigate that a bit more.  The music selection was fantastic though.

On to the food...

Two of us ordered the beet salad.  It was delish - had a sweet flavor - cinnamon, cardamom, something.  More beets - that's my usual request and it held true here.  The ricotta salata was divine.  The Caesar salad looked yummy and totally authentic with those little anchovies hanging on to the romaine.  

I had the Tonato sandwich.  The appearance was a bit "eh", but the taste was fantastic!  It's an open-faced sandwich and my thought is that open-faced equals pretty (like you reveal the inside to show off the beautiful contents).  Unfortunately, cooked tuna, artichoke, green olives and prosciutto don't have the most attractive color palate.  But, again, the flavors were a hit!  It was savory and the bread a bit sweet....mmmmm.  The side salad it came with was also very good - loved the celery seeds in the dressing and maybe just a bit too salty.  

One friend had the grilled cheese, which was thoroughly enjoyed.  The other had the tuna tartar (awesome - loved the basil in it) and the calamari (again really well-seasoned and nicely presented).  

The service was a bit slow.  It was their FIRST service so it's totally understandable, but I thought the staff had a lot of chatter and pointing going on, trying to sort it all out and I know we're "friends and family", but please don't point at me - it makes me feel weird.  It's just something to note that during FiDi lunch hours, people really need smooth, consistent and well paced service.  I'm certain all of that will be great when they are officially open for business.

Well done Aventine - I'm looking forward to many more lunches and drinks with you.  I've got my coin collection started....
author: Mac M.

description: Warm and beautiful lighting.  A nice place to meet for a drink.  Love the cheese plate and the seaweed flecked popcorn.
author: Mymy T.

description: Loved this place for Happy Hour.  Crab sliders were my favourite.
author: T S.

description:
We came here for my goodbye happy hour last day at my old job.... 

$6 happy hour grey goose drinks... i mean need I say more?? So cheap, so tasty, and dang I got drunk quick!.  Usually full of beautiful people, (albeit there's some douchbags too, but hey it's the FiDi get used to it). 

The only complaint I'd have is the rediculous crowd.  Seriously tough to move by the end, and I'm pretty sure there was only 1 waitress and 1 bartender.  We tipped good and never seemed to wait at all this time, but the first time i was there I remember it being a little tricky.

I'll be back for the cheap drinks and cool atmosphere for suuure.
author: Joseph F.

description:
A great bar!  I love the design of the place and the abundance of rich wood.  I last attended a holiday party here and the staff was great.  I personally loved the cocktail waitress.  She was young, pretty and she had spunk.  She took good care of the people in the room.

The people in the bar were all part of the party so i can't speak to their normal crowds.  Needless to say our crowd was full of the young, smart and all around fabulous professionals.

The wines were good and they made good mixed drinks as well.  I stuck with wine for most of the night but i did sample some of my friends cocktails.  Good stuff!

Definatley a place you should hit up and one i will go out of my way to visit.
author: Reuben D.

description: The service was absolutely wonderful.  Vegetarian Pizza was yummy but a bit small for the price.
author: Jenn B.

description:
I really like this bar!  Most of the people working there are nice and helpful.  They don't spend their time trying to avoid eye contact in order to duck having to serve you.  Their selection of liquors is good, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is sophisticated and cozy.  

They hosted the Balvenie event here last night and it was a great time.  "Free" always brings out the worst in people (just visit a Yelp Elite event to see this in action), but Taverna dealt with the "low class chivalry is dead" people in an excellent manner.  Well done.
author: Corey V.

description:
This place is crawling with the after work crowd, I'm sure having happy hour prices from 3-7 p.m. is a huge draw.  

The dark and stormy on the happy hour menu was ok, but not gingery enough for my particular taste and the truffle popcorn was a huge disappointment. The popcorn had been sitting for a while (as in hours) and was cold, with very little truffle flavor.

The atmosphere is nice, but didn't make up for the sad excuse for truffle popcorn.
author: Lee H.

description:
I went here on a Thursday night for happy hour with my friends who were visiting from Chicago.  This was a great place to enjoy drinks in a mellow and classy environment.  They have a happy hour menu that goes from $6 and up.  

I tried out their moscow mule (vodka, ginger beer, and lime) and enjoyed it despite the random mix of flavors.  My friend, however, introduced me to a salty dog, and I have not been able to drink anything besides that!  Their drinks are the perfect combination of alcohol and mixer - I got a good buzz going after three drinks and was having a great time enjoying the people and the crowd.

I was feeling hungry and ordered the lamb sliders and popcorn. The popcorn is a MUST; we could not stop eating them!  They gave you pretty big servings, so we were really happy.  The lamb sliders were pretty good.  It came with two sliders; the meat was very juicy and the flavors were strong and succulent.  I enjoyed it thoroughly.

The service was great - our server came back everytime we were just finishing up our last drink, just in time to order another round.  There is also a downstairs area for private parties (my friend had his going away party there a while back).  

I enjoyed this place and would definitely go here again!
author: Tram T.

description: Natalie Rocks!!!  Natalie is hands down the best cocktail waitress in town!  She was fast, attentive and friendly...this place was so busy and she was still on her A game!
author: Michelle A.

description:
Went here today for a happy hour.  Cool vibe downstairs, alright appetizers, okay wine list.

Didn't try any of their cocktails.  I'm sure I will be back to give them another shot, although I think I'll have a snack first...
author: Sarah G.

description:
Paid several visits with coworkers, and I think it's safe to say that we're all sold - we're regulars.

Raving bar, especially during happy hours. The crowd is classy, and the mood is very upbeat. It's also a big plus that they're located 30sec from work.

Order any cocktail - you won't be disappointed. I've tried too many drinks to even know where to start, so I won't bother reviewing individual items. But overall, it's fantastic.

Price: $30/person after tax and tip
author: Jack W.

description:
Finally a very decent after work bar in the North Financial District.

Great drinks, great crowd, good appetizers, good happy hour scene.  Best of all no Cigar smoke like the nearby Cigar Bar.

This place draws a happening free spending, well dressed crowd of financial people and creative professionals starting at about 6pm and it rolls from there.    It can get preppy but not in a bad Marina, "I'm too dumb drunk giggly to be interesting" kind of way.

Highly recommended if you want to play it safe and convenient for after work.  Almost certain to be an energetic fun crowd any weeknight.
author: Bruce C.

description:
Aventine can tend to get a little douchey with the after work FiDi crowd, but I've found the downstairs is a quiet refuge from the hook-up madness upstairs.
They've got an amazing happy hour with huge pours of wine for not a lot of money.  Plus for every 1 you buy you get a little wooden chip.  Collect 4 chips and you get a free drink!  Great service, and they've even got truffled popcorn.
author: Sarah M.

description: I just cannot get into this place.  Happy hour could be good if it weren't packed with wall-to-wall 20-something Marina-ites in between their day-job in the financial district and looking to hook up before they head home.  Met some people for a work day lunch and the food was mediocre across the board.  One person ordered the pretzel bread hoagie -- sounds great on paper, but he left hungry! What?!  So many more interesting places for both drinks and food within a stone's throw, you just have to look around.
author: e w.

description: This place is a really chill spot. Great drinks, atmosphere, and people. Was there just last evening for a friends going away party. Lots of fun!
author: Bennie B.

description: It gets loud at Happy Hour, but it has good drinks and a good-looking-and-thank-God-it's-not-the-Marina crowd.  Love it!
author: Kristen S.

description:
This spot is HOT!  And not the hot you maybe thinking.  The basement area sucks big time, a small wall unit a/c is simply not cutting it when you have 50 plus people mingling and dancing around.  On multiple occasions we had to step out side for fresh air!  The drinks were good and pricey with one bartender  working the place alone and did a good job getting everyone to their happy place.  The place is really nice along a cute little alley that reminded me of NYC.  We had a blast because of the occasion but the heat factor was a big hurdle, by the end of the night you could definitely tell who didn't put enough deodorant on!!
P.S. Please fix the leak in the downstairs bathroom, the wet floor was not cool...
author: La C.

description:
I always walk in here in the hopes of seeing a sailor or two.  But, the food will just have to do and I'm ok with that.  Aventine is off the beaten North Beach path so usually only locals are in there.  Its pretty well hidden. 

I've only had a few beers and some lunch.  They have a shrimp and corn soup that is amazing.  The staff is very friendly and loves to chat about whats been going on there.  I love that its small but very open.  A great place to just hang out for a bit.
author: jessica b.

description:
Geez so I came here during happy hour on a weekday and it was pretty empty upstairs in the main area, but there was a fundraiser downstairs that my friend had brought me to so we went down there to check it out.

It's a swanky type place and not really my style.  The crowd is guys in jackets and suits and has a real financial district vibe to it which really isn't for me.  I met other friends who had been here before and were almost in a fight picked by another patron. Totally random to think about people still getting in fights in SF and especially at a schmancy place like this.

Lots of douchey guys who will hit on girls instantly so those ladies who complain that guys in SF don't hit on girls enough? this is your place!
author: Gene X.

description: Worst Irish bartender ever. Rude, obnoxious, and foul. Please don't go here. You'll be stupidly sorry.
author: Mei F.

description:
I'm not sure who invited "liquor lockers," but they deserve the bar award equivalent of an Oscar for their invention. I've only heard of one other bar in SF that caters to this new concept. Here's the deal, you purchase a bottle (or four), and you store the bottle(s) in their tricked out cellars. Anytime you want to stop by for a drink, just pop in, and a friendly cocktail waitress will be more than happy to pour you a drink with the mixer of your choice. 

Aside from this amazing feature, this bar continues to impress me with their courteous staff, tasty appetizers that take advantage of latest in SF cuisine, and creative cocktails that include energy infused vodka's (which Red Bull just isn't cutting it). Thursday nights are definitely poppin', but be warned, this spot can get really packed.
author: Michael H.

description: I went here for their happy hour on Friday.  The place was quite busy, as it should be - happy hour runs from 3-7PM!  The happy hour menu is great.  Cocktails were nice (I had the Moscow Mule while my friend got a great $6 Zinfindel) and we ordered the truffle popcorn for our small group to munch on.  There is a downstairs but it was closed due to a reservation.  After 7, the place really cleared out, giving us all some space to hang out.  I will definitely be returning.  Staff was also polite.  It's great to see a elegant bar with refreshing drinks and unique bar bites in the Financial District without it being too overbearing.  My only compliant - the place was a little bit meat market-ish.  Everyone notices everyone in this place.
author: Alyse S.

description:
Great Happy Hour spot!!!  Solid spot and would go back again and again.  Good size space - great drinks.  Good location.  On the edge of the FIDI and on the edge of North Beach and Chinatown for good dinner options afterwards.  

I had a great martini with 602 Gin - which hit the spot.  

If you get there early enough there are some great couch seats by the window which are so money.  Was in a group of ten and we were all able to have space and not feel jammed up.

Great mix of people - no douchiness during the 6-9 time on a Friday - not sure later in the night - I walked by after dinner and the music was turned up like ten notches and it is around the corner from the Bubble Lounge so you may get some douchy spillover.
author: Moe J.

description: When I think of Aventine, I smile. There aren't any other alley parties like it in SF. Yes, it does get extremely crowded so expect that or go early. My favorite things about Aventine: good looking crowd most of the time, inexpensive drinks, nice bartenders, and good music. I also like going for happy hour on a normal night. It's just an overall good place to drink in financial district. I've even tried the food (lamb burger, cheese and meat plate, etc.) and they are all pretty good.
author: Jenna Q.

description:
Stumbled across this bar last night walking to the Bubble Lounge.  My friend and I decided to grab a drink inside the already packed bar.  The crowd was a great mix of 30-something-year-olds not looking to get stupid drunk.  We headed downstairs for our drinks.  Downstairs had a great atmosphere with a bartender who had a constant smile on his face.  Even the crowd seemed extra friendly. 

Cool moment of the night...As my friend and I had our drinks at the bar, one of the patrons ordered 5 Peroni beers.  As my friend was helping to hand over the drinks, the guy ended up giving him the last one just because.  

We had such a great time, we never made it to the Bubble Lounge.  But, I can guarantee that I will definitely be back here.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I'm resistant to updating this after I was hassled by some TA shill about my previous review, which I stand behind as reflecting my first experience at Taverna Aventine

But last night I had a fantastic time with great service and  great drinks.  I really appreciate that Ryan, the GM stopped to give us a lesson on the building's history and how they designed the place around the old retaining wall.  I was much better able to appreciate the space when he explained the layers of masonry and how they built the bar out of the building's old floorboards.  The bartenders and servers were over the top in their service and kindness, the drinks were superbly well made and the food was tasty.  I've been converted.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Another lovely night at TA - this time with a history lesson!  Ryan (the GM) was kind enough to show us the history of the different styles of masonry and explain a bit more about what the area was originally used for and how they pulled original materials to make the bar what it is.  Plus, did you know most of the buildings use old sunken ships as part of their foundation down here?  In any case, I don't think I'd like to be downstairs when the big one hits, in case tsunamis are also involved or sinking or some other nightmarish catastrophe.  But let's not dwell on these things!
The Pisco Punch was fruity and fun, and the snacks were pretty tasty too.  If they are any indication of the lunch fare, I'll have to check it out next time I'm free for a midday lunch downtown.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Fun little spot for drinks.  They also have food but i haven't eat here so can't comment on that. They have a main upstairs and a downstairs.  It harkens back to the old days a bit with the wood and mason jar glasses. 
They have a good wine selection and make a mean mojito!  Worth a visit to hang out and have a drink with friends.
author: Ka C.

description:
I come here alot for lunch. The bartenders are super nice, and the manager is a pretty cool guy. Real people...not just nice because your a customer. 

Id get the steak sandwich....its my favorite thing on the menu....also the cucumber collins is a refreshing little cocktail.  I say this because at least once a week for the past 3 months, its been a staple for me. 

Ive also hit this place up for happy hour on Friday....Again, bartender is prompt, and generally a pretty cool guy. 

GO HERE...tip well...they deserve it!
author: Clayton D.

description:
This place has such a cool vibe, the next time I am in North Beach with friends (read: some time in the summer) I'm totally going to suggest going here. It's always good to know solid places to visit with good seating, a beautiful bar and enough space to breathe. The drinks were well made and the bartender personable. 

The only pointer I would give is although you are going for a worn look, I would highly advise sanding down or lacquering over any bare wood or major nicks that are in the wood along the bar or the wall bar. Because leaning against them catches your clothes and they are liable to make holes in someone's shirt. And make someone very unhappy that their new top is ripped.

Happily the shirt I had on that night has so many snags in it, I could care less.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Lots of Old World SF charm and verrrry sexy... just what you'd expect from the guys at Vintage 415.

Taverna Aventine just opened to the public today, and I'm sure it will be much more successful than the clothing boutique that used to be there (does anyone remember what that place was?). Starting Monday, they will be serving up tasty Cal-Ital bites for lunch. Hit it up for happy hour and late night absinthe cocktails.

I love the large mural of Rome's skyline on the wall above the staircase. The swanky downstairs parlor has the original seawall exposed with lots of nautical touches in the decor. The coolest part? The uber exclusive lockers big spenders can rent to stow away their liquor to enjoy them during private hours. 

I see a locker with a plaque marked "Nish & His Angels" in the very new future...
author: Connie C.

description:
When the VIntage 415 guys open up a new place, ears perk up and expectations are high. Taverna Aventine might be my favorite spot of theirs so far, because it captures that feeling of living in another time -- perhaps the 1920s in old school San Francisco.

I first got to check it out on friends & family night before it opened, when the absinthe drinks were flowing and it was mellow and buzzing with beautiful people. The downstairs was roped off, but we snuck down and ended up getting a private tour by the owner, Todd. The basement is swanky and low-lit, and most notably, home to private liquor lockers. 

Nish and I went back for lunch, and I was blown away be the menu! The Hog Island Kumamoto oysters, smallish and super rich and creamy, started us off right. Mmmm. The poached tuna sandwich with a slice of prociutto on top was pure heaven, and the pork braised sandwich was just right. Make a reservation guys -- the place is already packed!

Note: All I want for Christmas is a Yelp liquor locker.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Taverna Aventine JUST opened and I was fortunate enough to get a peek at it tonight while it's still a hot new scoop. 

They did a great job with the space. A bit of Old World SF with a modern and Italian twist (plus perhaps a dash of Martha Stewart's nautical summer issue). It's a very hip spot, that should be welcomed with open arms in its location. A lot of the original materials were kept in tact post-renovation, which is very cool and they've stashed little goodies around like antique SF maps and old photos that act as additional reminders of local maritime history. The downstairs "parlor" is cooler than upstairs, I suppose that's why its set aside for "insiders" and special events. The brick walls in down there are like 150 years old and are stained with saltwater from the ocean... which is rad. 

Also, I love the social club aspect. *Someday* I'm gonna snag a coveted liquor locker in the "Parlor." And I'm gonna keep all kinds of fancy exclusive stuff in it. Booyah.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Went here with some work folks and was not disappointed.  Good selection of beers and a damn fine martini to start things off.

Pizza and sandwiches we ordered were good, although they took a little longer than they should have.  

Price was reasonable.  An all around good experience.
author: Mike I.

description: Suits Suits Suits EVERYWHERE! Total FiDi happy hour scene if that's what you are into. Really friendly bartenders and I like the downstairs area. The place is small and the two times I have been here I've walked right by it without realizing it. The first time was for a tech talk during happy hour time on Thursday. Not the best venue for that type of event since the place is small and noisy. The second time was on a Saturday night. The place was very mellow on Saturday which is good and bad depending on what you are looking for. If you want to escape Bubble Lounge or the loud North Beach scene this is a good place to grab a couple.
author: Debbie C.

description:
I'd like to go back in time and offer the owners some cash in exchange for a share of this place. I swear that EVERY time I pass by this place it is *packed* full of people enjoying a refreshing beverage. Did I mention they all seem well-to-do, good looking, and generally happy?

One can only hope to be surrounded by people like this all the time.

My review is a little biased because the only time I went here was for a Wokai fundraiser. The drinks were reasonably priced, and when I went for a refill on iced tea, the bartender just refilled it for free and smiled. Very nice, dude.

I guess this place could be a bit less crowded...but then wouldn't it be less fun? I will give this place a true review when I have gone drinking here. But as it is, it's a fine place.
author: Aaron F.

description:
Great Happy Hour place for the FiDi crowd or if your looking to meet some FiDi men.  The alley way parties/happy hour is always a great spot to strike up conversations with those around you...lots of eye candy for your pick.  I don't know about the HH pricing as I didn't pay for my drinks, but seems like a lot of people like the atmosphere here.  

  As it gets later, a DJ shows up and starts playin, the alley way starts to get way crowded..it took me about 10 minutes to get like 15 feet. Ridiculous.  Inside the bar is even worse! 

  The bar is long, the decor is dark & woodsy.  There is only 1 bathroom to share. WTF?! This place is a total fire hazard. 

  Nice place, but get there early & leave once the crowd starts packing in, it's just not worth it.
author: Lulu C.

description: I went here for the first time on Cinco de Mayo. The place was a little crowded because of the private party downstairs, but the atmosphere was great. The place was nice and clean and there were happy people all over the place.
author: Juan S.

description:
Came here for lunch with one of my girlfriends.  Found it on www.restaurant.com and had a gift certificate.  The food was really great and fresh!  The service was also great.  Pricey but worth it if you have the gift certificate.

Just a little snug but it wasn't packed at all during lunch.  I'm sure it's more busy during happy hour.  I will definitely be returning (probably with said gal pal once again).  Like I said, the food was really yummy!  Plus my girlfriend didn't like something about her sandwich and the waiter took it back and she got a new one.  Great place!!
author: Kay R.

description:
Slightly intimidating, was my first impression. 

Headed out here with my girl friends to check out Friday Happy Hour, we got there around 5 and despite the place being full of people there was plenty of parking right in front, sweet. The moment I walked inside I was like whoa, everyone seems older, so tall, and dressed so well (all the SUITS SUITS comments on yelp is exactly correct)! I don't know what it is about the crowd; we are girls of 5ft couple inches height and in our early 20's, and for some reason I just felt out of place. We still hung around and enjoyed some 1/2 off drinks. 

So HH is only 1/2 off on well drinks and wine - having not been informed of that I ordered a cocktail, it was called "The Nichol" being a Nicole I "had to get it" it but it was $10, rip off especially since they only fill your cup 1/2 way up with the drink. Lame. 

Yelpers keep mentioning the downstairs, but the evening we went it was closed, there isn't much seating only a couple individual sized couches by the window so most everyone stands. There's also an outside, we were told we couldn't go there, but that may have been because it was "block party" Friday.
author: Nicole L.

description: I often frequent Aventine because it's on my walk home from work in the financial district.  The bar is consistently crowded, but not soo much that it turns the group away. There's often snacks too (if you can get to them) on the bar, but I'd recommend camping out at a table or the window booth and getting the popcorn or a few appetizers to share with your group.  They also have a downstairs bar area that's often reserved but great for private events!  Overall great spot, but a litttttle too crowded for an A+ experience.
author: Renae K.

description:
There's a downstairs area? I had no idea. 

This place was packed on St. Patty's night, inside and out. 

The crowd was definitely diverse.

Drinks were decent, but the makeshift bathrooms (porto-potties), were DISGUSTING!

I liked the DJ music in the alley. 

Would like to come here on a normal night.
author: Misha F.

description: Went here for the big St. Patrick's day block party. It's exclusive and if you got in you're on of the lucky ones. I have only been one other time and I'm a fan. Great vibe, and an amazing place to go after work for happy hour! A cool place to take friends from out of town since the Transamerica Pyramid is directly across the street. Always a plus!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I've only been here once and it was a brief encounter with friends before going to dinner. 

My first impression of the place is that it was....busy, not that that is a bad thing (depending on your mood and tolerance for drunken socialites)  I stood around and sipped on my gibson vodka martini, (which was ok but getting the job done) and observed the crowd which by my observations were made up of young professionals, young  professionals desperately trying to hold onto their college years and some DINKS. ( I fall into the 1st and last category and on special occasions the 2nd....come on people gettting old isnt something to look forward to is it?!) 

The parking is better than other locations because there are a few garages nearby and you could get lucky and get some street parking.

The drink prices are pretty good but the battle to get to the bar and actually order a drink is a bit challenging.

Overall, I would visit again great prices, people watching and mingling in a no-divy environment suit me just fine.
author: Sandra M.

description:
This place is beautiful. I, too was here for the grand opening party/outdoor DJ fest. Since when did people get so grumpy about consuming alcohol with beautiful people on a day with gorgeous weather? Not to mention a beautiful if not slightly intimidating position right at the foot of Transamerica Pyramid.

I had a fantastic time! Yes, people here are mainly from FiDi. DUH. That's where this bar is located. Why wouldn't you stop by for after work drinks at a bar close to work? Common sense, y'all. 

I can agree that there needed to be more bartenders working that night for what the establishment had to assume was a large opening crowd. Less bartenders that night meant they all got stressed out more easily, and were grumpier as the night went on, but hey, that's the typical human reaction when people don't ask for their order nicely. The 'tenders did a fine job considering what they had to work with.

Got hit on by plenty of people, which was fun, it was a very warm day, so I cracked up when more than one person elected to open with the line "it's really hot in here, huh?" "Yes, hot guy, it is."

So, back to the party. I was allowed to bring glass outside, and didn't have any plastic cup issues that others mentioned. Tip: hold the drink down low and on the opposite side from the bouncer. 

The DJ's music selection was a fun-to-hang-out-to flashback to my junior high dances of yore. 

Aventine did a nice job planning with the extra toilets in the alley and temporary outdoor bar.

Fab decor, smells good inside, and love the lightbulbs above the bar and dead-to-real seawall downstairs.

I will be back to check out the food, the people and to put down a payment on my very own basement locker!
author: Allie F.

description:
Small little place, down-stair has a little sitting area 

But what kind of bar doesn't carry midori?? The bartender wasn't too friendly in suggesting alternative... 

They have no food either, so my friends and I went to other place to eat afterward
author: Coco L.

description:
Adore the decor and vibe. 

We went for lunch and my chicken caesar salad was woefully small and unfilling. Please add salt/seasonings to chicken. Please provide more lettuce and croutons and dressing. Thank you.
author: Deb I.

description:
I've been here for happy hour and it always draws a good crowd....Today I finally went over for lunch.  Everything we had was excellent.

The apps were excellent, we had the burrata/costini and the melon with prosciuitto  - both were outstanding!  

Although unoriginal, we all had the rigatoni bolognese...What can we say, we were all craving carbs.  In any event each of us finished every bit of the dish.  

Service is great, the bar has a great interior and vibe about it.  Go check it out and you will soon be a fan.
author: Doug C.

description:
Why exactly do you put something on the menu IF YOU NEVER HAVE IT?  I think I've been to Aventine 3 times now and wanted to order the burrata - either in sandwich form or salad - and they've never had it?  Not to mention, their service is super slow at both lunch and happy hour.  

Anyway, good thing I used my restaurant.com coupons, which made it a lot cheaper.
author: Olivia T.

description:
I was there on Saturday for a couple b-day parties... the crowd was diverse enough to keep it interesting as there wasn't just ONE demographic.

It wasn't a "young" spot which meant the average age was probably about 33... and that alone is a breath of fresh air (at times).

The downstairs area is probably where the majority of the better "looking" people hung out, however poor ventilation meant it got stuffy pretty quickly.

The bartenders were all really good and surprisingly attentive.  They made sure to get drink orders not only from the people right at the bar, but also people one row deep... and that's not something you see at a lot of places.

The place was quaint, service was good and I'd definitely go back to make sure it wasn't a "fluke".

Oh, and for those driving in... parking wasn't bad on Washington coming in from the Embarcadero... especially for a Saturday night!
author: Claudio d.

description: I had a great time at Aventine, even though I was only there for 15 minutes or so. The decor is fresh, the vibe is alive... and as one comes to expect with a vintage joint, its a beautiful, young, entrepreneurial, fashion-conscious crowd. I'll have to come back for a proper sandwich. El Nisho got me fired up on that pork number.
author: Sam S.

description:
The best service I've had in SF in a long time! GREAT wait staff. Check out the cool area downstairs while you are there!

PS - Food is good but don't order the Tuna Tartar. It's served in bowl and is kind of a sloppy mess. Too bad because the flavor was really good, but who wants to be digging their tuna out of a bowl with a crustini when you are trying to share with a group?
author: Lance B.

description:
Go early (before 5:30pm) if you want to hang out in the street level bar. Otherwise, it's pretty crowded 6-8pm. We went downstairs to the Cellar, and while a bit stuffy, it didn't bother me on a cold January night. 

After a long, crazy & unpredictable work week, this is the just the place my co-workers and I needed. Go for the martinis and good-looking people watching, stay for the popcorn with truffle salt when you get thirsty. It's addictive, almost more so than the cocktails. 

By 8:30pm we were back upstairs and able to have a nice chat with the cute young bartender and meet a few other folks hanging out. We didn't eat here so I can't review the food. But I'd like to go back. Actually I am going back for a 40th b-day party in a couple weeks.

This is a fun place for an after-work drink with friends (and happy hour specials.) I will definitely go back.
author: Muir P.

description: Two floors, long and narrow, with a bar on each floor. No dancing on a recent Friday night, limited seating. Pretty crowd. Was that fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice in my greyhound?
author: Pamela S.

description: One of my favorite happy hour spots, this place is a perfect place to bring a group of friends on a week night and grab a cocktail. I personally enjoy the acai lemonade cocktail they serve up. Their truffle popcorn is also amazing, and a must-try. There are 2 levels to this place-- the downstairs is located to the left when you walk in, by the bar. It's a cool atmosphere on both levels. The downstairs kind of reminds me of a wine cellar, where the top floor has bench seats by the windows, and a few tables. The crowd here is the usual fi-di crowd, which I like.
author: Ashley D.

description:
My friend reserved the downstairs bar for his birthday a couple weeks ago and I reluctantly attended after a day of feeling achy.

Maybe it was late, maybe it's cause it was just a really really busy day and they just ran out of stuff. Seriously though, who the heck serves warm Guiness? It's absolutely foul. To make things more annoying, they couldn't make any of the drinks I wanted because they didn't have the ingredients. 

Ventilation was crappy too, the downstairs isn't good for a huge party. Upstairs, where something else was being held, seemed pretty nice though.
author: Joanna L.

description:
One of the problems of having a booze-free lunch is that I am far less predisposed to reflect kindly on the experience afterwards. While it is not the fault of the establishment (as long as they serve booze), I also have to say that I think it heightens my critical faculties and thus renders a more honest and subjective assessment. 

That said, I thought Aventine was O.K., had some flaws that still bug me, but, it is a place I would definitely give another try. 

Decor: Awesome! I totally dig the super-architectual wall paper, the bare wood, the minimalist yet creative fixtures and the space. 

Seating: I loathe stools, and most of the seating, at least upstairs, is on stools. Bleh! Also, there is nowhere to put your coat or bag except balled on the floor. 

Service: Weird. The woman was not rude but not friendly. Seemed to have a touch of attitude. Order was mixed up and took quite a while. The waiter checked in to tell us our salads were coming up, but, was not particularly sorry about the long wait. 

Food: Oh boy, tuna tartare! Why, you NEVER see tuna tar-fucking-tare on the menu these days, do you? Let's order that! Honestly, it was good tuna tartare, and they seem to have toast down, but, jeez, not very interesting. 

Caesar salad, that was another "novelty" on the menu. At least they threatened to put actual anchovies on the salad, which, while not technically correct, is a bold move. But, since both my dining companions asked for no anchovy, my requested anchovies were also missing. Yet it took so long to get the salad, I did not make a fuss about the lack of actual anchovy on my salad. 

The salad greens were super-crunchy and cold, so, that was a big plus, but, the dressing was mouth-searingly garlicky. I have to say it was over-garlicky. It was almost pleasant in it's amazing strength, but, ultimately, was overdone. It is four days later and I STILL have the sense-memory of super-strong garlick in my mouth.  I suppose it would not have mattered if I had gotten the anchovies - I am sure I would not have been able to taste them. 

Glasses: Everything seemed to be served in mason jars. I like mason jars but for some reason I hated that everything (well, water and iced tea) was in mason jars. I suppose if we ordered wine it would have been in something different, but, like I said, this was a no-alcohol excursion and we did not find out. 

Patrons: Definitely a lot of entitled ladies and douchebags dined here during lunch on Good Friday, I can only imagine what a week-night happy hour is like here. 

Like I said, I probably need a few drinks and I would be more of a fan. My husband works nearby, so I promise to do a follow up.
author: Jim K.

description:
This is just a review for their bar, not the food.

I went to Aventine for a drink with my girlfriends before a night out. It's a great place to meet up and have a nice drink or two! The drinks are great, really well made, and pretty strong. The atmosphere is fantastic, the design of the space is rustic old Italian style/feel (much like the Brass Monkey in New York, if you've ever heard of it.)

 The only reason I'm not giving the bar a better rating is because it didn't WOW me. The drinks are great, the staff is nice but didn't go above and beyond. The crowd was a little pretentious. We tried grabbing an extra chair from one of the tables and I specifically remember someone giving us grief about it. I'll be back soon to try the food, hopefully my review will be better then!
author: Sarah T.

description:
I've been here for lunch and happy hour a couple of times.  I really like the vibe, it's a good place to meet someone for a glass of wine (props to their happy hour special on wines....) or for a simple biz lunch

Their menu is slim pickings.... not a ton to choose from.  Last night literally three of the 8 things on the menu they were out of.  I was starving and really wanted some bread and cheese - of course they were out of it... so I asked for some bread: I got literally NOTHING - not even a response or facial gesture from the server, it was rather odd.  So we ended up ordering a plate of salami which had a lot of great meats, but only 8 dinky crackers for the three of us.  It was weird.  

I would, however, go here over WINE bar in 2EC any day.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Cheers to Taverna Aventine for hosting the latest Yuppy Friday! 

The downstairs bar was full of the young and beautiful of San Francisco supporting the SFFD in their quest to help the children of SF at this holiday season. 

The drinks were well mixed and creative... putting great twists on even classic cocktail recipes... making them their own while still holding true to tradition. 

This is a great meeting place for FiDi folks, as well as those going out in North Beach in the eveings.
author: Jordan Y.

description: I've been here for lunch twice now and the food and service has been the same both times; great.
author: Christopher B.

description: I've been to Taverna Aventine before for drinks and thought I would check it out for lunch the other day.  I really like the layout and look of the bar but I was not that impressed with the food.  It was ok but since there are so many good lunch options around this area, I would not head back there.  I think they're trying to be too fancy with their menu when it could be scaled back and still be good bar food.  I'd come back for drinks but food not so much.
author: Blake B.

description: Aventine is a FIDI staple for happy hour. I am involved with a charitable organization, Yuppie Friday, and they have repeatedly hosted events for us and been wonderful. We work with most bars/venues in the FIDI area and Aventine is consistently one of the most professional and easiest to work with. The venue is beautiful and makes you feel right at home with their first class mixologist cocktails whether you are in the well lit upstairs or the exposed brink basement. I can't say enough how great Aventine is both as a place I enjoy for a cocktail and as a supporter of San Francisco non-profits.
author: Jordan A.

description:
LIke the ambience. The Happy Hour drinks were great! (ends at 7p!)
My house merlot was really yummy for $6; they were very generous with the pour too. 
And...the grilled paninis were amazing! Yum!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I kicked off my vaca in San Fran with a cocktail from Taverna Aventine with a good college friend of mine. This place is a small, quaint bar with a lot of unique and tasty drinks. We scored two seats right at the bar on a busy Friday evening. It was rather dark - so dark we had to move the drink menu towards the light to read it (okay, maybe I'm old, but my friend couldn't read it either!).

I ordered the Gin Rickey:  tanqueray #10 gin, lime juice, simple syrup, cucumber slices - so yummy in my tummy - highly recommended.

If I lived and/or worked in this area, I'd frequent this place for sure.
author: Sharon W.

description: Cool neighborhood fidi bar but some friday happy hours are packed as hell.  Its a good time to be a dirty old man and grab some free booty.  I went to the 2 year anniversary and I couldnt move worth shit.  Too fat.  Somewhere barked in the middle of the alley towards the front of the place.  Freakin nasty.  The DJ that night was awesome.
author: Fatty A.

description: Decent place for happy hour- friendly service, strong well drinks, and nice atmosphere. I also tried the sliders and the truffle popcorn. Both were delicious, if a bit overpriced.
author: Cathy S.

description:
This is a great place to go with your pirate friends.  It has that "old maritime bar" vibe with lots of old dark wood and crumbly bricks.  There's a great basement with comfy seating and neato light fixtures, but why oh why do they have the liquor locked up in cages?  Set it free!  

Don H. will tell you they have one of the best rums in stock, and after tasting it, it's now my favorite too.  Really nice folks work here, and it's a great place to get cozy on a cold night.  Savvy?
author: Andi T.

description: Sliders with bacon (x2), ice cold Stella... an excellent work week lunch. Wish there was a third slider and fries, but oh well.
author: Maximillian M.

description: It's a cute little bar in downtown SF, had some amazing food/drink here on my bday last year! 4 stars.
author: Will P.

description:
Here is the deal.

The location draws a very specific crowd here. And the crowd triples in size during happy hour.

Even though, not a bad place to grab a martini with a group during happy hour. $6 for a cocktail with top shelf liquor. 

Recommendation:
If you can find room to eat it, order the cheese plate/salami combo. Very high quality and well worth the $22.

You've just been yelped in.
author: Aaron A.

description: Nice happy hour, limited menu.. Packed, nice servers, fight your way for a seat! ;-)
author: Bobby L.

description:
The appetizer menu is not bad...cheese plate is very good, as well as the tuna tartar.  One thing I did like a lot was the drinks are very generous.  They pour more than average.  :-)

Unless I worked right around there, there's nothing special about this place.  We got there around 5:30pm and all the seats were taken.  We were standing the whole time.  I do have to give credit to the waitress to asked a group of ladies who took up 2 tables to give up one table and give it to me and my friends.  Kudos to her.  

It's not one of those places I would think of going unless I was right in the neighborhood.
author: Annie S.

description:
Jenny tahra, and natalie are sooooo hot, but more importantly, they give great service.  

Peace - Kevin
author: Kevin J.

description:
Came here for Happy Hour.  

I enjoyed the Moscow Mule and the Dark And Stormy.  The Acai Lemonade is just super sweet and electric pink!  The sugariness of the drink masks the alcohol very well making it tastes like juice, but I'm not a fan of it.  Tried the sliders on the menu, the hamburger meat tasted awfully dry.  They only offer bar bites, there's no full menu that I'm aware of.  

I'm told that the downstairs is really cool.  But I'm also told it's almost always booked for a private even so it's a hit or miss if you'll ever get to see the original SF seawall when Montgomery Street was where the harbor used to have begun.  

Arrive before 6pm if you want to score one of the very few high tables in the bar.  There was 2 tables left when we arrive there around 5:15pm on a Tuesday evening and only 1 table had chairs.  It fills up quickly after 6pm rolls around.  It fills with your typical FiDi crowd, all in suits.  

It's not quite or intimate at all.  Pretty packed and rowdy.  With all the ruckus, it'll be hard pressed to carry a conversation with even the person next to you.  

If crowds your scene, this is it.  If you like the FiDi people, come here.  If you want peace and quiet, come by 5pm leave by 6pm.  They have 2 tables outside but those are gone very quickly, especially on nice afternoons.
author: David C.

description:
Liked the space, feel and general atmosphere here, I think it fills a big void in the downtown scene. 

So, I want to like it more, but any place that sells PBR for $4 a can is a rip off in my book.
author: Jason M.

description: Charles Dickens got it wrong.  At least if he subscribed to Yelp in present day, when he coined one of his famous opening line scribbles "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times."  Had Charles visited Taverna Aventine located in the heart of San Francisco's Financial District on 582 Washington Street, in its present day, anachronism though it very well may be, he would have simply phrased it as, "It was the best of times, until it got even better."  Whether it's a Thursday or Friday Happy Hour with colleagues for a welcomed respite of spirits or for one of Taverna Aventine's famous block party's, despite the instance, Taverna Aventine surely proves to never yield a disappointing moment.
author: Dan S.

description:
Love, love, love this place. 

Both the upstairs and downstairs are super cozy, and the wine selection is excellent. Personally, i'd return for the super energetic staff alone. Although I haven't tried the food, methinks i'll be returning many, many times from here on out.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
Happy Hour 
$6 wine: heavy pours, great wine -steal my heart. 
Truffle Popcorn for only $3- pinch me, I'm dreaming. 

Weekend (non Happy-Hour) 
Nearly $60 for 3 well vodka (Smirnoff) drinks and 2 Jack and Cokes- way to fit in with every other bar in San Fran. 

If you're going to charge upwards of $10 for each drink- please, at least offer me a dance floor to make a fool of myself on and semi VIP area I can swindle my way into for some sweet people watching. 

The bar back/ bus boy smelled pretty bad too (noticeably bad- ick). 

I'll be back, during the week, during happy hour, and I'll be sure to swing for some of their specialty cocktails. We'll see if that swings them up to 4 stars. (Ok- really I just want an excuse for more drinks.. haha).
author: Kaitlyn G.

description:
I work just up the Hotaling alley so I am quite pleased that there is a new bar nearby that doesn't specialize in a beverage I detest for the most part.

The elements that are the same as the nearby Bubble Lounge are the ones to keep.  That is: respecting the building they're in and having copious amounts of eye candy.  The buildings are historic as is the whole Jackson Square area and it is nice to see places embrace this.  As to the eye candy...I've been here directly after work and it fills up with many girls that are very easy on the eyes and all dressed very nicely.  Seriously, do these people dress this way at their jobs?  If so, I'm glad I don't work in that kind of environment.  The drawback is that I'm always the only one there who looks like he didn't go to the office that day!

As for Aventine itself...nice old school incandescent lights.  Good barkeeps.  Great interior.  High prices (a smidgen above normal prices).  The eats are so-so (don't get the clams) and not worth the price.  Try Uva in my hood on how to do the eats right in the same genre.

Overall...nice quality place to have a drink after work with some friends...
author: Chris D.

description: I am such a fan of this place that I'm always recommending it to all my friends and co-workers.  Really a great place for Happy Hour and if there's a block party by the Aventine you wont want to miss it! They have incredible cocktails!
author: Veronica C.

description:
Really like this place!

I've been here 3 times so far (it's close to the hubby's work) and it's been consistent - professional service, friendly bartenders/waiters, reasonable HH prices and gotta love the exposed brick inside. 

My current drink obsession are Manhattans and I LOVE Aventine's Manhattans cuz they serve it with brandied cherries.

YUMMY and recommended... too bad this is my last week of indulging in cocktails and sweets. :(
author: Nenette Y.

description:
