Cool venue with a cool history.  The staff was very friendly; pouring tastes of some of their unique liquors, and chatting us up.  They have a good selection of Tequila and make some tasty and novel cocktails too.

It looks like it would be a great place for meeting up with friends; the downstairs has couches and a loungy atmosphere.  Old school SF meets new school SF with the pyramid right across the street.

I like this place.

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description: Love Love Love Love this place! This is a hidden gem in my eyes. I came here today for the first time with some friends for happy hour. It was definitely a happy time! When we got there it wasn't too crowded. The place and the atmosphere is great. Little touches here and there like a pretty little flower on the table add a classic feel to this place. Not trendy (at least not to me) at all and just a place to relax, drink and hangout. We ordered the truffle popcorn and the platter of appetizers (crackers, fruit, pickled things, cheese, and nuts). This was a perfect snack and good to feed three people. We were full by the end. As happy hour begins to get crowded, it becomes sexy dim. Everybody is having a good time and you can tell by all the happy faces....Definitely will come back for more fun!
author: Mel P.

description: ok, I was scared by the sheer volume of the block party and we didn't even attempt to join in.  But it's a scene, if you're into that.
author: Meg W.

description: I like Taverna Aventine. Its small enough that it feels intimate, but large enough to be comfortable at Happy Hour. It's a good go-to that's centrally located, fun, and good drinks.
author: Katie M.

description: A classy venue that is not pretentious.  I love the set-up and how there is an upstairs and a downstairs that can be used for private parties.  It's a "cool" speakeasy atmosphere where anyone who enjoys a good drink can fit in.  Best of all the owner is a charitable guy who is always up for hosting a great party.  Thank you Aventine!
author: Heather M.

description: This was a fun place to come for happy hour on a Friday night.  Service was a bit slow since it was crowded.  They only have Guinness and Stella on tap, but their wine list and cocktail selection aren't bad.
author: Kelly K.

description: I met the most interesting peeps each time I was there for HH!  The last time I went there was for a Chilean fund-raise party at their basement-cellar, fun place!   I enjoyed their great mixed olives snack & great merlot selection.  I have just gotten an excuse to head back for lunch soon, who's coming with me?
author: Linda L.

description: good happy hour spot...filled with popcorn. i have some new stomping grounds and have been getting to know the different spots around my area. while they are limited, they are still great finds. the ambience and decor is pretty great and classy! the drinks are $6 during happy hour and there are great bar food choices, including truffled popcorn, however, the service here is a little slow. overall, this is an easy go-to for a thursday night!
author: Marjie T.

description:
if this bar was a man i would fall in love with him. don't tell my husband tho.  

taverna aventine is classic, it feels a little older, well-traveled, well-read, and appreciative of the finer things, but not snobbish or precious. a man's man, but with class. kind of like george clooney. mmm. george...

ok back to the bar. it's masculine, but not overly so, and overall feels warm and inviting. the upstairs is flooded with natural light from windows that line one side of it, and this is prime space cause it was already full of people at 5:30. the floors are rustic wood, and the walls are a warm shade of blue.  the downstairs is dark and cozy and has it's own bar plus a small lounge area. i was a huge fan of all the design touches, from the lights hanging over the bar, to the apothecary chest. 

the happy hour is great. i can't speak to the cocktails, but they have nice wines and at $6 a glass for a very hefty pour it's a deal. we also ordered some food, and while not spectacular, it was still very good and not too pricey.  the service was friendly and helpful, of course we were a group of 6 girls and they were male bartenders, but still. they played great music too. we liked it so much that our happy hour when far into the happy place. next thing we knew it was after 9. i think that's when you know you've found a spot you want to return to.
author: rachel p.

description: Great spot for drinks after work. Across the street from the Transamerica pyramid. Friends were hosting a party in the front "library" with bottle service so my drink was the way I like it...strong! Bought one at the bar too, good pour. Not cheap. Lots of good looking people dressed business casual. I guess bankers don't wear jeans to work on Fridays!
author: David A.

description: Cool bar with a somewhat nice/artsy interior. Love the exposed brick! Gets crowded during happy hour with the FiDi yuppies, especially Fridays. Hard to get to the bar and the cocktail servers are a bit slow, but it's a nice little spot for a drink. They also serve food, but I didn't have a chance to try it. Maybe next time.
author: Linda C.

description: Came here on the Bastille Day Party for Happy hour, but without happy hour price, of course. They took the whole alley and have DJ playing music. I choked two Beer in half an hour because I have to leave and go somewhere on time... Shame! Wish I could stay longer... Always like little place looks nice. Definitely will come back. 1 star off the fan because the bartender's service was too slow. And I'm not a patient customer. LOL
author: Flora F.

description:
Very crowded Friday night. Lucky us, finding two seats at the bar. Lovely atmosphere. Intriguing cocktail menu. 

Finally get a drink, but it's disappointing for the $10 price. Not enough care taken. Terrible sound system playing 80's music too loudly. Rude people next to us ordering Bud Light. 

Toured swanky basement. Smells like mold. No thanks.

If you are going to tout your establishment as a a high end cocktail lounge, don't serve Bud Light. You are drawing the wrong crowd. This is not vintage SF, this is frat boy haven. Blech.
author: melissa n.

description: Great wine, decor, location and people. Minus 1 star for getting my wallet stolen here, though.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
thus far i've gone on two separate occasions with different girlfriends and both of them commented on the excess of men in striped shirts, which were completely accurate observations. good on both of them.

now that that's out of the way, this place has all the ingredients for a good to great HH in FiDi: drink specials, yummy eats, great location, just enough breathing room and good looking people (as collared, button-down, striped shirt-wearing as they may be. god bless 'em.)
author: Kay L.

description: The uptight over-consertative dress is still aplenty here but I stopped by for a drink on Cinqo de Mayo and damn did they make a good margarita!
author: Lauren B.

description:
I had a group of friends here for my birthday the other week and reserved the front library area. Although small, it was quite comfortable for a combination of sitting and milling around. The service was excellent and the waitstaff very attentive. We called ahead for a bunch of small plates and although a bit on the pricey side, they did not disappoint. The oyster and prosecco shooters were particularly amazing. And for a Tuesday, the crowd was solid. 

In general, I like Aventine, particularly as a happy hour option or for something different for lunch. I have been several times after work and it has always offered a good crowd and nice vibe.
author: Alex F.

description: This place was really fun for happy hour! it got a bit crowded as it got later but overall it was fun. The truffle popcorn was amazing!!!! Their happy hour menu was limited but good!!!!
author: Elyse M.

description:
Worst place ever. I've never seen such a rude and imbecile bouncer in my life. A group of us, about 15 people, tried to get into the bar, and were unpleasantly stopped by the doorman lying to us and saying  that our IDs were fake, even though half of our group were already inside the bar.
Then came the annoying 30 min wait of the bouncer trying to get us to stay and argue with him when he was absolutely wrong just so he could waste our time.
I would say this was the worst place I have ever been. If you want to have a stupid person argue with you, then by all means go.
author: Michael K.

description: Very crowded after work scene. I found the most obnoxious thing to be the servers pushing people around to get food through. I understand they are just trying to do their job, but they had a nasty look on their face and physically pushed me so they could get through. Watch out and hold your drink so you don't spill it when they come by! They had reasonable happy hour prices and a decent drink list. I probably will not be coming back because being pushed around and watching my drink every time a server comes by to make sure it wouldn't spill was way to stressful - not the happy hour I envisioned.
author: Lauren H.

description: 1st time I was here with 2 girlfriends and it was fairly empty. But the bartenders were nice and the drinks were fine. The next time, it was packed. The crowd was early 30s. Once again, bartenders were friendly and the ambiance was up-beat. From the other bars I've visited in that neighborhood, this was one of the top contenders.Less hipster/divey but not too yuppie either. Good in-between.
author: Freda F.

description:
taverna aventine kept their door ajar for me, letting through subtle rays of low, lantern-like lighting, inviting a closer look to discover exposed brick walls and wooden accents.  

well-dressed financial district-ers chatted over wine, mostly.  cabs and pinots danced in wine glasses, to the likes of talib kweli and camp lo.  - - the bartenders' music choice was a VERY nice surprise.  

the lower level revealed a more intimate area, a second bar, along w/liquor lockers for members only.  ...members who like to have a drink and shoot the breeze w/other members?  ...members who run out of room for their booze in their own basement?  shrug.  ...interesting concept, nevertheless.

i must remark though, that it's been a common occurrence lately that the impressive decor of an establishment doesn't automatically translate to awesomeness in other critical areas.  - - my cranberry grey gooses were 90% cranberry and 10% goose.  cahm ahhhhn.  don't skimp on the geese.  let them fly freely, down my throat.  ...where they belong.  ...it was also strange that the bathroom downstairs boasted of single control, rustic bronze faucets (yes, i'm a nerdy architect who notices bathroom fixtures after i pee), but there was no sign of toilet seat covers.  ...did i miss it?

...a lovely space to get together w/friends every once in a while, or, in my case, to learn from my happy hour buddy that i'm an amiable socializer, and to also get my recommended monthly serving of cranberry juice.
author: Ting A.

description:
cool and hip new joint.

a stylish spot to grab a drink or a lunch bite created by the vintage 415 boys and gian-paolo veronese who's alioto lineage runs far back in sf.

the warm interior was long and deep with seating in the front and back.  
what you think may be just another bar has its secret down below.

the downstairs area  with interior detailing dating over 100 years old houses the members only club.  

complete with leather seating, some tall table seats and a full bar.
weathered lockers hold personal liquor bottles that you purchase and store as needed.

all of which made me wonder what will they come up with next?
author: Anh V.

description:
Review on Taverna Aventine for private events only. I rented the downstairs of Taverna Aventine recently. 

Likes: Great bartender "James". Super nice guy, very easy to work with. Atmosphere was good. 

Dislikes: Management is difficult to work with. The food was nowhere near as good as what they present in the restaurant. You pay a lot more and get a lot less and the presentation is definitely not as nice. Do not purchase the cheese platter unless you get in writing exactly what they are going to do. We expected something nice for the cost and while it was good cheese, it was all shoved on a small platter with no toothpicks or garnishes and only a small amount of plain wheat crackers were provided no nearly enough for the amount of cheese provided. Also the sliders came plain - with just meat and bread - no garnishes at all. Overall execution on food was REALLY REALLY BAD. Maybe the usual chef was sick that day? I have put on many events and this was by far the worst presentation of food from what I would consider a good to upper-end establishment. Warm food was all made well ahead of time as well and was cold and utensils and plates were not provided as agreed. Don't trust what you're told or get in writing - management is not honest. When we asked about a refund for poor execution and spending well over $3000 at the venue. We were basically told "too bad". I'm an easy going guy that only expects what is contractually agreed to. This company does not honor commitments to customers. Watch out. I'm giving them a [1] for not taking responsibility and ownership of the poor service my group received. Good luck
author: Ben G.

description: A cool new bar in the Jackson Square neighborhood. I checked this place out for a Friday happy hour and it was packed... and hot. Lots of FIDI suits and a slightly off-balance guy to girl ratio. Nonetheless, it had a good vibe and the place is well done... minus the "book" shelves... really? I don't really remember if there were any HH specials... all my drinks seemed to cost $8 which I feel is pretty standard anywhere. The front area seems to be the best spot if you can snag it. They have a downstairs but unfortunately it was closed for a private party that night (or maybe I just wasn't cool enough). I'd definitely hit this spot up again although I'd probably avoid Friday night. Happy drinking!
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description: It's hip, well decorated and packed after work. I remember walking nearby and hearing music emanating from the alley way one Friday evening.  I came yesterday during happy hour and it was packed. During 4-7, their drinks are really reasonably priced. I ordered a french martini with a splash of champers and a dirty belvedere martini...it was only $16! And, they made my french martini perfectly.  I also saw others order bar food and the board of mixed salamis and prosciutto looked really delicious. I think they also serve lunch as I saw their menu which had a bunch of panini and salads. Crowd is definitely FiDi.
author: Natalie S.

description: Nice new spot for Happy Hour. They start early to accommodate those of us that work market hours. The interior is sleek industrial with a touch of old school den/library feel. The service was great and they tended to our large group despite a lot of rowdiness. We tasted the house made pate and salumi....delicious! Overall a nice spot to add to the rotation.
author: Stacy T.

description: I've been here for happy hour and for lunch.  The portions are small, but the food is excellent.  Really, that's not a drawback, just be sure to order an appetizer.  The drinks are quite good.
author: Andy G.

description: The only time I really like this place is when they have block parties to be honest.  The bartenders are always pretty nice and attentive, but the drinks are standard, the food is very mediocre with small portions and overpriced....
author: Gohar J.

description: I have only been here twice and I have only drinkin wine but i feel like they have some good quality wines and great HH prices and it is just so cozy and cute!! def recommend if you are nearby and want to grab a drink and take a load off :)
author: Lisa Z.

description: I went to one of the openings this past Friday.  Good crowd, good music, steep priced drinks in plastic cups...the usual.  I had a great time though and I liked what they did with the place.  I would be curious to check it out sometime after work sooner rather than later.  Only downsides, didn't particularly care for the female bartender (I don't think many people did, especially other females as she only seemed to serve dudes) or the one bathroom.  Good place though and because it's so new, you're guaranteed a good crowd for a while.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Writing a review about lunch at Aventine, and I can tell you it did not live up to expectations.  My friend and I ordered potato garlic soup, Lardon and Frisee salad, pastured beef sliders, and Tuscan Steak Salad.  The soup was decent, fairly smooth, but not much potato consistency and flovrs were bland.  The soup was served with a few slices of toasted bread.  The Lardon and Frisee salad was very dissappointing.  The salad had no frisee, the lardons were just bacon slices, and the poached egg was leaking.  To make matters worse, the dressing was tasteless.  I am a big fan of this classic french salad that brings together contrasting ingredients and combines them in a tantalizing way.  This salad did not do justice to the real thing.  The beef sliders used the wrong bread, instead of mini rolls, they used baggettes sections which were very tough to chew, and made eating the burger a chore.  The beef was under seasoned and not very flavorful.  the burger looked nothing like the picture on the restaurant's website.  Also a very dissappointing dish.  Finally, the Tuscan Steak sandwich.   The beef was mediocre, seemed more like a skirt steak for a fajita than anything resembling Italian.  The parmesan (semi-melted) and the arugula (completely wilted) were present as expected, and the truffle oil added a little sophistication.  This was an okay/mediocre offering, and certainly better than the beef slider.  Overall, this venue has good ambiance and vibe.  Maybe I caught them on an off day or maybe the lunch menu isn't prepared by the night chef, but I was really expecting a lot more.  I pass by frequenlty and have wondered whether it would good.  The happy hour scene is probably a better reason to come, but I wouldn't go there again for the food.
author: Ronald W.

description: Nice place. Arrived a little after 4pm on a Friday for happy hour with a friend. Giving it 4 stars for their drink the Pomerita. Super good and only $6. Its delish!! They have a pretty cool downstairs area too. Nothing super special but I definitely will be back!
author: rita s.

description: Went to Aventine on a Friday night for dinner.  But they only served appetizers.  However, they were pretty good size appetizers, mostly in the $10-$12 range.  We had a couple pizzas (1 fontina, 1 with arugula) chicken skewers, and sashimi tuna.  I recommend all of them, the pizzas were great.  The wine by the glass list was decent (about 12-15 selections), and the cab franc was pretty good.   The wines by the glass were around $10-$15.
author: Joel F.

description: The bar was a little too crowded yesterday with Yuppie Friday going on, but what made it a good night was our great waitress, Natalie! Despite the deluge of people, she made sure we always had our drinks. So, overall, a really fun time!
author: Earl D.

description: Two words: Pisco Punch. When a girlfriend suggested trying this place out, I rolled my eyes big time. What nerve to suggest hanging out in Financial District --- at night! What a surprise. This place is pretty cool to hang out in. The attitudes are kept in check, so the crowd is tolerable. The bar-staff is awesome and knows how to keep the drinks flowing.
author: Jen A.

description: My friends from the yelp community took me here and wow, it is amazingly clean. But the thing that really slapped me in the face was the faucet. You need to come over just to use it after eating your meal or something. Geez. Those guys Zack and Ryan are real people too, come out and visit them and their faucet of awesome.
author: Ryan R.

description: Good drinks, friendly ppl, cool interior.  I had fun.
author: shoba d.

description: Awesome place, great food and decor and always a good time.
author: Andy P.

description: I like this bar. Never had food here but the crowd is the obvious downtown crowd. Drinks are good and bartenders are easy to get to. Downstairs is a bit tight but is pretty chill.
author: Mike C.

description: Great place for happy hour and I love the downstairs cave-like taverna. The manager and staff are super nice and I would recommend the salad nicoise.
author: Sonya Y.

description: Great happy hour! Cocktails are $4. If you are looking for a scene, this not so much the place. I was there on a Thursday, thinking it was going to be a but nuts, yet super tame. We were one of 4 people at the bar. Yet the bar keep was really nice, so a good time was had by all!
author: Nicole F.

description: no different in stars for service, or venue in general but a second complaint about throwing large parties here...parties in the alley sound fun in summer but 200+ drunk morons spilling their drinks on you and stepping on you or pushing you over not even caring where they are going is just not my cup of tea...hard to believe i found that fun at 20 but maybe being so drunk you dont notice helps?
author: Farrah S.

description: I am a fan. I find all the staff to be pretty friendly. I like the decor and the location. Good service and great happy hour. The food is a bit over priced especially in this econ.!   The manager small blonde girl and the doorman Benjiman were cool.   But I will be back!   thx
author: Mike T.

description: The Vintage boys have done it again.  Great atmosphere, cool buildout, nice location, solid drinks...  The crowd can be random, but what do you expect in the FiDi?  I'll be back, for sure.
author: S B.

description: I came here for the block party last Friday - so fun!  Although, it got too packed and the bathroom line was horrendous!  The decor is very swanky and hip and the drinks were goos.  I would like to come here on another night to see how it is when there aren't hundreds of people and nowhere to sit....
author: Megan H.

description: This is a cool place for happy hour!  I enjoyed the crowd and their happy hour list.  My malbec was delicious!  The only downside is it's hard to carry a conversation upstairs.  It's lofty and it gets noisy fast.
author: Gina W.

description: Best of breed financial district bar and happy hour joint, though I wouldn't come out of my way to make it here if I didn't work 2 minutes away.
author: Alex R.

description: I think the atmosphere is basic Jackson Square yuppie, but it's fun and it's nice that they serve food for happy hour.  It would be nice if they served more snacks to drink with like an enoteca.  How about a cheese plate.  Or, small finger food.  Or nuts.  Or something to soak up the alcohol.
author: Melanie C.

description:
this past saturday marked, perhaps, a turning point - not only was i able to request a song, the bar staff didn't seem like they minded at all . . . that flexibility makes up for the awkward pauses throughout the evening when they run thru the ipod playlist trying to find something new . . . good tradeoff!

would have been 4 stars, but weekday music is SO BIZARRE.  went with my coworkers once and we experienced the gamut from dreamy trance to muzak to jazz to hip hop to some strange ethnic stuff involving chanting and lots of drums . . . . ( ' (oo) ' )`  pigs can't take such variation all at once on a tuesday night!!!

other than that, drinks are well made, and it's not *too* crowded usually

watch out - on thursdays they often close early (like @ 1) for some bizarre reason
author: Vicki Y.

description: Great for happy hour. Good deals on drinks & appetizers; good service and a good crowd.. Even when its very full its never overwhelming.
author: Marianne C.

description: It's nice enough, but every time I've been its been packed with nowhere to sit. That's obviously good for business, however just not really that much room to hang out and enjoy a drink. The drinks are decent but overpriced, but I guess that comes with the territory...
author: Nicolas H.

description: was here for a private party, so don't know what it'd be like on a normal evening.  But I liked the space, and the drinks, and the staff, so off to a good start in my book
author: James R.

description: We came here on a Monday and had the place pretty much all to ourselves. I had a champagne cocktail that was delish. The bartender/server was very friendly, but we were disappointed that they didn't have much in the way of happy hour. The food came in very small portions and wasn't veggie friendly. Overall, rather pricey but a nice place to sit with the gals.
author: Tamara M.

description: I like this place, cozy, nice ambiance, the downstairs bartender is very cool. Downstairs kind of feels like a dungeon but I think that's what their going for. I recommend going with some friends to chill out or a mid-week happy hour spot. I went on  a Saturday night and the place was empty aside from our crowd. I think in general the Fidi kind of closes down on weekends.
author: christina C.

description: It was a Friday evening, at happy hour, when I went to Aventine. It's approximately a ten minute walk from either Montgomery or Embarcadero BART stations, and is close to some dining options along Columbus Ave, making it a good pre-dinner stop. At first glance, it appears to be a small space, but there is a full length lower level. It was packed with people, but the lower level was less crowded than the main level. The crowd was mostly young professionals, with a sprinkling of middle aged people here and there. They did have a live DJ there, playing a variety of modern tunes, and some classical pop hits, but I found the music to be a bit too loud. That night, a friend asked of my opinion of the place, and my exact response was, "I'd like it even more if the music weren't so loud". There was a happy hour drink menu, with a few interesting sounding concoctions, though I went for a glass of wine. Though the price for a glass of wine wasn't a spectacular happy hour deal, the pour was a very generous one. Apparently, they are open as a restaurant during lunch time hours, so I may swing by one day to check that out. It's worth checking out, just be prepared for loud music.
author: Damon Z.

description: What makes this place great is the attitude of the staff.   They've got a good group of people working there who make you feel right at home.  The quality of food and wine on the menu are top notch.   The Vintage guys really know how to run a bar/restaurant.
author: Fred X.

description:
Financial District needed a new happy hour bar, and this one is a beauty in its interior and location.  The clientele is sometimes dressed as if they are on a sex and the city episode, and are trying very hard to be young, hip, urban and successful, and as a result this place isn't very relaxing.  One can get the same mixed drink a few blocks away for half the price but you don't come here for bargains.  The place is extremely packed with the after-work crowd on Thursday nights, but other nights and weekends can be a little too quiet.  

Great location and attractive bar and setting.  Come here when you are dressed to kill and want to flaunt your assets.
author: Firecracker P.

description: Married to the Ave - the alley and the city itself.
author: Beer L.

description: i come here often for their free cheese happy hour on tuesday.  nothing better to top a tuesday work day with a glass of wine and some free cheese and crackers!  cute bar and has a downstairs area that's nice for private parties.
author: Helen T.

description: This place has a very cool/hip ambiance and is a great place to meet up for drinks. The staff is friendly and that is always a bonus in my book. The happy hour is not that great so for those looking for a deal, I dont think this is the place for you.
author: Madeline T.

description: Small, and yet very noisy. I didn't get to experience the downstairs, but I came here on a mellow Monday evening. Early, around 6, but upstairs was still relatively full. This is a classic financial district bar. A little too swanky for my taste, and the food, while good, was small. This place is ok, just nothing amazing.
author: Rachel H.

description: These guys have one of the best steak sandwiches I have had.  Super tender steak on a soft fresh roll with tangy parmesean shavings.  Service was friednly and attentive.
author: Alon R.

description: My group and I were on our way to Bubble Lounge when we spotted a nice, clean bar, looked attractive from the outside. It would've been really nice to have everybody go in and get a drink. However... I didn't even make it pass the front door. First time a doorman, or ANYONE, ever tells me my driver license is fake. Ridiculous. Completely unheard of and unreal. Not even a complement that I looked young for my age (23) or of the sort. Even more ridiculous is that the doorman accused my friends' drivers licenses of also being fakes and denied entry. I thought he was kidding and joked to him saying that I bought my 'fake' ID from a guy called the DMV... but he didn't get it. Not worth the aggravation from his simple mindedness. No blacklight, no swipe of my ID, no proof my ID or others were fake. Didn't even apologize for his actions. And he was rude and tried to make me feel stupid. I didn't take a Norcal trip just to get hassled by some guy who can't tell the difference between a real ID and another real ID. Too bad Aventine, you just lost 15 customers who wanted to drink.
author: Andrew K.

description: Disclaimer: this is just an initial review so don't get your feathers ruffled!  I am reviewing only on my experience last night for the grand opening party.  So, when you introduce your place to the world, one would think you would try extra hard to make a great impression, right??  Don't get me wrong, I am a huge fan of the Vintage 415 eateries, so I was super stoked to hear about checking this place out.  My friend and I rsvp'd with glee to the event.  We showed up and the place was packed with financial district happy hour goers and the usual Johnny Marina and Jane Marina's of the world.  We make our way to the bar, which was tended by three.  To our excitement we get right up to the bar in front of the bartender.  She is doing her rounds of helping people out.  So, when my turn rolls around, some stupid chic jumps up in front of me and orders her drinks.  Ok, that's fine.  I will be next.  Oh, no.  The bartender continues to serve everyone else around me and my friend for at least three other rounds.  Stupid, inconsiderate people abound at this place and don't have the courtesy to say, "they were here before me, so please serve them next." I mean, c'mon people, step outside of your special "me me" world and realize others do exist.  The bartender even smiled at me twice, so I figured I would get a drink eventually.  About thirty minutes later after being ignored, even though raising my hand, a kind gentleman finally let us order before him.  Finally a drink!  Well, a luke warm corona was what I got and I couldn't even get the bartenders attention to get a plastic cup and god forbid a lime for my drink.  We make our way out but unfortunately can't get out of the scorching restaurant to join the block party ensuing outside because we have glass bottles.  SHOCKER. We did enjoy our time inside watching people make fools of themselves.  We finally make our way outside and a nice cocktail waitress asks us right away if we would like a drink.  Why, yes, another Corona please!  She returns with two corona's in bottles outside and we please ask for two cups so that we don't get yelled at by the bouncer again.  Oh and by the way, the cocktail waitress had no idea what beers they served.  We wanted a Stella which she said they didn't have but apparently they did (if you work at the place, shouldn't you know what beers you have??).  So, another warm corona that fizzes up so much because of the warmth.  Chic never returns with limes and cups and big bouncer heads our way.  He totally gets in our face and pumps his already large 300lb body at us.  The two of us at five foot nothing don't even come close to adding up to his weight.  He was a total ass and didn't seem to care about the multiple groups of guys around us with their glass bottles.  So, back we go inside.  We finally bolt because we are so disgusted.  C'mon now!  First off, when you want to impress your customers hire staff who know what you serve and how to provide good customer service. I will give the place one more try for the food but at this point I am very disappointed in Aventine.  I don't like to give bad reviews but I want to alert these guys that they really need to improve on their customer service.  Hey, if you took the time to read this ranting review, more power to you!
author: Carolyn D.

description: Hey Ladies and Gents, Vintage 415 has opened another cool place in the financial district, hooray! Well, much to my chagrin I am not sure I'll be back to this establishment. I'm all for people watching, dancing in a crowd, enjoying the excitement of a new bar with fashion forward San Franciscans, but not this past Friday night. I completely understand rules and waiting in line, but come on... when you're ignored by the bartender who attends to the ill mannered who shout out their drink orders after you've awaited your turn, it makes a girl a little crazy. Not to mention the fact that she did not even offer a plastic cup so that we could have had the option to go outside and enjoy the festivities. Immediately after being served, she turned away and there was no way we were getting her attention for the rest of the night. So the doorman then proceeds to enforce the rules and not allow us to go out without a plastic cup. Fair enough, we finish our libations and then go outside to enjoy the merrymakers. Yay, a cocktail waitress quickly arrives and takes our drink orders. Oh, the night started a little rocky, but it is improving. Well, not so quickly. We order our drinks and she returns with glass bottles. Okay, she says she will return with the plastic cups so we can stay outside. Well, the doorman makes a B line for us and seriously tries to rough us up, not cool dude. He was a complete jerk, only to be too much of a wimp to enforce his rules to all the guys around holding glass containers. Okay, I'm not impressed, and completely disappointed. I will still enjoy dancing to DJ AM and enjoying a Big Dog now and again, but Taverna Aventine is lacking the sparkle that most of Vintage 415 venues tend to excel in.
author: B K.

description: great warm space...the weather has been wonderful he past few days but i can imagine spending some foggy nights cozying up to this bar.
author: Angela N.

description: This is place okay.  Nice decor and ambiance - they did a good job with the place.  The service however was very frustrating last Friday at one of their openings.  It seemed as though they didn't take into account that it was an opening as they had three people (you would think that would be sufficient)  working the inside bar but in actuality, they really weren't working - they were just chatting it up amongst themselves or with patrons.  The female bartender would only serve males which was pretty lame and it seemed like the concept of having to work and serve a crowded bar was foreign.  Considering we're in a recession and times are difficult for some, a lot of people aren't going out as much and they will be inclined to take their business elsewhere if service isn't up to par.  Sucks but true.  I'd be willing to give this place the benefit of the doubt considering it was an opening when I went so hopefully this was a one time "hiccup" on their part.
author: Danielle V.

description: good real happy hour specials that aren't the house wines or made from cheap liquors.
author: leah g.

description: I've been here for a lunch a couple of times.  The last time was terrible -- service was really really slow, food portions were as tiny as ever but also inconsistent (2 of us ordered the same thing and they came out with totally different portions) and the pasta dish was bad - sauce was Ragu- bland and the pasta itself was something I could have made with the cheaper brand of pasta they have at Safeway.  All for $20+ pp.  Never again!!
author: Gina C.

description: the food selection was sparse.  the drinks and atmosphere were ok.  come for happy hour and bring a megaphone.
author: Big e.
